A huge battle fought at Perryville and another yesterday many killed on both sides - I went down street to day and did some shopping - Mr & Mrs Ely called to see us to night - Mr Badger gone to church meeting - baby a great deal better Belle also well - 
Tuesday Oct 14
Mr Hunt arrived this morning - we all well to day - I am making children red & white ? dresses - I went out to day in my new drab? hat -Mr Hunt came to see us Mr Badger is gone to the Hotel with him - received a letter from Pa - Mrs Beidmond? & daughter called
Wednesday Oct 15 - 1862
It is a beautiful day - Ella Badger came and took Belle Eva & Ada to her house to spend the day - I went visiting called on Mrs S. A. Smith - Le. Laflin Mrs Gusnee Mrs Walker & Mrs Miller Mrs L. L Hayes Mrs Moulten Mrs B. F Haddock Mrs Adams Allen & Mrs Dreffield then I got Mr Badger and boy Sheridan and went to the West end for children - returned home late - at nine O'clock there was a large torch procession to meet the Bishop Dregan - who has just returned from Ensape? - they played beautiful music he made some remarks - 
Thursday Oct 16 - 
More lovely weather - we all well - children gone down town - Mary Lyons came to see them - to night they have gone to see Clara Wheelas? Mr Badger gone to the Meeting of the Ministry at Sarge - I wrote to Pa - Mr Hunt took dinner with us -

[At top of page above header   Calls 17   baby 2 upper teeth]
Friday Oct 17, 1862
It is beautiful to day.  I went visiting all day - called on Mrs Willard  Mrs T. M Walker - Mrs F. Y Adams  Mrs Leonard  Mrs Byford  Miss McCabe  Miss Stewart    after Tea I called to see Mrs Flint & Misses Clarks   On returning I lost my new onyx sleeve button.  Mr. Badger is out.
Saturday Friday crossed out Oct 18
It is lovely to day.  I do not feel well.  I will write to sister Belle.   Mrs Badger gone to see Mr Hunt.  Sunday they will leave for New York.  Belle & Eva gone down street
Sunday Oct 19, 1862
It is again lovely weather    all gone to Church but me.    Mr Hunt dined with me - Mr Badger and children gone to their Grandpa Badgers   Brackett Badger arrived today from New York.     John Hilton came from Louisville.  I wrote to Pa.     Walter Hilton Brackett & Albert Badger all came to see us.  Mr Badger and Mr Hunt left at 7 Oclock to night.  Mr. Badger felt badly about leaving us.
Monday Oct. 20
This is again a beautiful day.  all well but me - Brackett Badger is staying with us on a visit.   children have gone to invite some friends of ours to the club.
Tuesday Oct 21st
More charming weather.  I feel a little better.   have invited about 30 besides our club.   I have finished childrens tartelons    will write to morrow to Mr. Badger -  baby has 2 upper teeth.
Wednesday Oct 22nd
It is still charming weather.  I got a hack and took all the children out inviting friends.   I wrote to Mr Badger   I was invited to go to the Theatre to night by Octave & Brackett
Thursday Oct 23rd
We are quite busy to day arranging for Club to night of the Grass hoppers.  Brackett Badger gave me a handsome vase to hold the grape tree - it was fixed very pretty with grapes tied on      at nine the company began to assemble - many were in full dress - all looked well.   about 150 persons were here - we had good music - children all looked well - and danced well.  Sheridan danced the Polka and was very much applauded.    about 12 O.clock Leiutennant Cook and Mr. Bird came with the Government band the 16 Illinois regimental.   they played beautiful Music - we invited all into supper.   there was many in the band -  after they eat they went into the Vestibule and played more      twice they played Dixie for me - the Leiutennant said he would have them play all night if I said so - I wish he had been in earnest.    the company left at 3 Oclock - all seemed to enjoy themselves.   it was a brilliant crowd - I wish Mr Badger had been here  - some sent regrets -  we all well - it rained slightly

[Written at top above header   visits 29-Oct &30th   Rebekah $4.00   /  24th Louisa 21-24    hannah away Saturday & Monday]
Friday Oct 24th
I rose to nine Oclock breakast - Ella Badger stayed all night   she and Belle did not get up untill 2 Oclock.  Eva and other children at ten    all very tired    I wrote to Virginia to day - received a letter from David.
Saturday Oct 25
It is very cold to day and is snowing fast.  Ella went home after Tea   Walter Hilton Albert Badger Brackett & Octave all came and played cards with me - received a letter from Mr Badger - all well
Sunday Oct 26
the snow is on the ground and walking is very bad - I went to church with Belle & Eva -  after dinner went to Father Badgers   returned at nine.   boys all came home to tea? with us - Octave Brackett Albert Walter and Mr Gennett
Monday Oct 27 - 1862
I went shopping to day with Belle & Eva.   did not return untill after dark -  after tea went with Walter and Octave and called on Miss Waller and Miss Stewart.  Hannah did not come -  snow all gone
Tuesday Oct 28
A beautiful day.    went shopping    wrote to Ma    Rebekah had a tooth pulled - all well - Hannah came    I gave five dollars to the fair for the Friendless    boys gone to Miss unclear   Belle & Eva went out to Grandpa's
Wednesday Oct 29
It is a lovely day -  I took a hack and made calls  -  I called on Mrs Robb - Mrs Turemone  Mrs Dr Parker - Forsythe  Mrs Price  Mrs Rogers Ontario street -  Mrs Goodwin  Mrs Leduc  Mrs Dr. Johnson  Mrs Wm Waller  Rev Clarkson  Mrs Dester -   the Bishop called on me Bishop Dugan (Catholic)    Clara Wheeler called to see me - children gone to Walkers
Thursday Oct 30th
This is a beautiful day.   Mrs & Miss Warner called -  Ms Flint -  Mrs & Miss Foster -  Mrs Wheeler  Mrs S. A Smith -    after Ten young Wheeler called   so did Miss Ward & her Brother.   Brackett taken Belle Eva & Ada to the Fair   I received a letter from Lill?      last night at eight I heard some one cry murder - near our house -    it proved to be a Gentleman who left the Clifton house and reached the Corner of Madison & Michigan when he was seized by two men and choked & beat and they attempted to rob him - but did not succeed - some one came to his assistance.
Friday Oct 31st
This has been a splendid day -  we all very well -    I sent for a hack and went visiting -  bought a new white shawl - also children Plush Cloaks     I called on Mrs Vandervogt  Mrs Porter  Mrs Caulfeld  Mrs M. B. Farlin - Mrs Whitney Farlin  Mrs B. F. Sherman  Mrs Hunt  Mrs Seaverns  Mrs Duncan  Mrs Endicott  Mrs Morris       M. O. Walker Gilman  Mrs Farnham  - children went to see Duffields - Bella Gurnee?  came to see Ada -  it is lovely Indian Summer

[Above header bar}   School Nov 5]
Saturday Nov 1st 1862
Again we have lovely weather -  children all took their bath - we all well    last night at 12 OClock - the Government band #16 - gave me another serenade.  I went shopping to day took Ada & Sheridan with me -  it turned cool and Ada took cold.   I gave Hannah a Collar.
Sunday Nov 2nd 1862
It rained this morning so we could not go to the depot.   but Wm Badger came at nine - quite well - he brought us many pretty present  me a handsome moire Antique and a black silk dress  --  a steel shawl pin and 2 buckles -  pictures for Album.  Ada and Album    Sheridan a leather hat and children pictures and fine pears  - baby a pretty powder box   many other small things he brought    after dinner we went to Father Badgers -  Mr Badger went to church.
Monday Nov 3rd
Received a letter from home  - we all well -  Sister Lavinia & Ellen took dinner with us -  I went down street and did some shipping -  after Ten Mr Badger and I went to see Rev Thomas & wife - children all gone to Father Badgers -  Misses Hearmons called
Tuesday Nov 4th
Fine weatther   we all well  -  Mr Badger gone to Porkhouse with John Hilton - Brackett Badger went away to Joliet to night -  after dinner I went shopping  -  Miss Stewart came to see me -- after Ten Mr David Henly called to see me --
Wednesday Nov 5th
It is a little cold to day -- we all well -- it is raining after breakfast   Mr Badger and I went with Belle & Eva to take them to school.   they much delighted   they begin to the Dearborn Seminary  -  they have  many pupils - a large building -- at 8 Oclock Mr Badger and I went to Mrs Flints to the sewing society - we spent a very pleasant evening - we danced
Thursday Nov 6th
It is my reception day -  Mrs Butler  Miss Butler & Mrs Turnly came to see me -  we are having our piano fixed -  it snowed very much at 4 Oclock.   Mr Badger bought leather gloves and a fine robe for a sleigh -   children have gone out to uy books  -  I am making Plush cloaks for children
Friday Nov 7
beautiful day   Aunt Harriet and Ella spent day and night with me   we went after Tea with children to the Fair   for the home of the Friendless  -- had a leasant evening  - Octave took me and Mr Badger  Aunt Harriet.

Sunday Nov 9th
It is beautiful to day.  I am quite well - so is all our family.   Mr Badger gone to west end to the Universalist Sunday school -  children to Unitarian  and I intend to go with Wheelers to Grace Church after donner   I went with Ada & Sheridan to Father Badgers to say Good Bye to Aunt Wendell who leaves for Block Island in the morning
Monday Nov 10th
It looks like rain to day.   I went down town with Sheridan shopping  returned at four O.clock.   made preparations for the Nite? Party --   at nine Mr Badger & I went   -  there were many there -- has a fine band of music  -  I danced every sett.   No supper -  it is not allwed by the club.  every one put into a baskett something for the sick soldiers -  we returned at 12 O.Clock -
Tuesday Nov 11th 1862
It has been raining all day.   children went to school  -  we received an invitation to Miss Butler's party thrusday night   Hannah not well to day -
Wednesday Nov 12th 1862
I went shopping with Ada to day  - we all quite well -  Mrs & Miss Whitehouse called -
Thursday Nov 13th
This is my reception day - Miss Flint called  Mrs Moulten  Mrs Wilson & Miss Wilson  Mrs. Luduc  Mrs King & Mrs Whitney Parkin -- Miss Brown called to invite us to Tea.     we went to Dr Butlers party and had a pleasant evening - a great crowd and fine supper
Friday Nov 14
It is cold but clear - I went out all day  -  making children yellow Merinos with white fold braided in black.  Mary Willard invited children to her house to morrow -  Mrs Hobson making children white velvet hats -  we all well - received a letter from David -  children gone to Walkers
Saturday Nov 15th 1862 
This is an ugly boisterous day  -  wind very high  -  children gone to Williards to tea  -  I walked out   saw many friends   Capt Brownax? came home with me - had a nice time - children invited to a party Monday at Beechers.  Mr Badger gone for children.  received letters from home - 
Sunday Nov 16 1862
It rains to day - yet all are going to church - children wore their new white velvet Hats and black plush cloaks trimmed with brass buttons  I wrote home to Pa and Sister Horace took dinner with us.
Monday Nov 17
I went shopping to day   Sister Licinia Hilton came her with her three chldren - Hutchings Alice and Florence -  they went to Beechers party with Belle Eva & Ada - they stayed all night.

Tuesday November 18th 1862
It is still Raining children gone to school - Sister Licinia & Alice Florence and Ella all spent the day with me - after dinner we all went shopping - Brackett arrived to day - Hilton children stayed all night with us again - we had a dance after Tea.
Wednesday November 19
It is cloudy to day and cold, nurse Ellen gone down town and I nursing - making children black spencers trimmed with red - also finishing their yellow merino's trimmed with white gold merino braided in black - Hiltons children gone home at four - Mrs Redmond & daughter called to see me - I received letters from home - Belle & Eva had the dress maker to fit them to day - first time in their lives   I make their dresses usually -   I went down town and ordered a head dress for Licinia
Thursday Nov 20th 
It snowed very fast this morning - but soon melted   Ada & Sheridan out in it  -  with Nancy it has continued bad all day - Mr Alcott called to see me - at 9 oclock we went out to Judge Green's to a  party - or our our Grasshopper club   - returned at two   Ada complained of her head where she fell and hurt
Friday Nov 21st
It is fine weather to day - Mrs S. S. Hayes called to see me - I went visiting called on Mrs Feild of New York   Mrs Wilson  Mrs Hadduck - Mrs Childer - Mrs Johnson of New York   Mrs Bentley   Mrs Tyler & Duffield -  Mrs Duffield has her daughter Alice sick with Typhoid Fever -  Mrs Gurnee & Miss Delia came to see me after Tea  Mrs Haley came to see us   so did Mr Bigelow - we all played cards until late   received the Greene's wedding cards - she married Mr Belt 
Saturday Nov 22nd
It looks like rain - we all well - at one O. clock I took a hack and went to Mrs Herfoots with Belle Eva & Brackett    the Duffield children came to see me - children gone to see Nellie Clyde 
Sunday Nov 23rd 
It has been a lovely day - I went to church with Mr Badger Belle Eva and Brackett - the family all went to Father Badgers but me - after Tea we all went to Unitarian Church - to the meeting of several schools - many pretty addresses  - Mr Bigelow came home with us 
Monday Nov 24th
It looks like rain - I went shopping all day - at nine O'clock I went with Mr Badger and Brackett to Mrs Millers party in behalf of Soldiers Aid Society   enjoyed myself much - danced a great deal - round dances and all - came home at 12
Tuesday Nov 25th
It threatened to snow - I went to the Funeral of Mr Walkers brother   he fell dead - was fifty two years old - was brought here to the City for interment - they live next door to us - we all well  -

Wednesday Nov 26th 1862
Received a letter from Sis - they all well -  making children cloth drab travelling dresses - hats and dresses trimmed with sky blue -  felt hats square crown - vrey pretty trimmed in blue velvet -  this is the day for Sue Greene's wedding - at 3 O.clock.   I went down town shopping and at three I went to Bishop Whitehouse's church (Episcopal Minister) - the church was crowded - but they gave us the front seat  -  I took Belle Eva Ada Cousin Brackett and myself - the whole ceremony passed off finely   six Bridesmaids and Groomsmen very handsomely dressed -  the Grooms name was Algernon Sidney Belt - after they were married they returned to Judge Greenes house had had the wedding supper from 4 to 6 Oclock  -  I was urged to remain all evening and about seven Oclock a band of music came and we danced untill eleven -  I sent children home early -  Bridal party return to Cedar Rapids to morrow
Thursday Nov 27 --
This is Thanksgiving day -  I went with Mr Badger and four children  Belle, Eva, Ada & Sheridan to Father Badgers - he had a very delightful day -  it snowed very much all day - we returned at ten O.Clock - Mrs Harrison has a very ill baby -
Friday Nov 28th
children have holiday to day - I took them shopping with me all day -  I received a letter from Sister Belle -  I bought Ada & Sheridan gray Plush cloaks - lso bought Ada a red velvet cloak -  I ordered myself a garnet colored Velet bonnet with a while Plume   Miss Norton visited us to a party at her house on Tuesday night -  A. D Hunt arrived from Louisville to day -  I wrote to Sister Belle to night
Saturday Nov 29 1862
I am busy to day - after breakfast I went down town with Belle & Eva -  the ground full of snow its quite cold.   Mr A. D. Hunt arrived from Louisville yesterday morning.  Eva has bad cold - all the rest well -  Mrs Field called to see me, so did Miss Matilda & Hattie Clark  -- Mr Hunt took tea with us  -  after Tea Mr Seammon & his son Leist Seammons came to see us.
Sunday Nov 30th
This is an ugly day - very sloppy -  Mr Badger gone to Church -  I did not go -  Mr Hunt spent the whole day with us -  Mr Badger was walked tome to Tremont Hotel with him - Eva has Fever with her cold.  Mr Carter Harrison has lost his baby - brain fever - they had a post mortem examination
Monday Dec 1st
It is very cloudy and cold - Miss Agusta Gurnee came to invite Octave to her whist club.  I went shopping all day.  Eva better -  received a letter from home - they all well -  I am making Ada & Shridan plush drab cloaks - little Clarks called to see children

Tuesday Dec. 1st 1862
It is bright but cold  - I went visiting - called on Rutters - Mrs Carver  Mrs Clyde  Mrs Peck & Jones.   invited Miss Brown Miss Walker Misses Gurnee  Miss Ward  Miss Flint  Miss Emerson  Miss Stewart   Miss Waller  Miss Clark  to be with me new years Afternoon  -  sent regret to Hortons party   Mr Hunt  Walter Hilton   Mr Wilson & Mr Hayworth all called to see us   Miss Cunningham and Mrs Gutherie called to see me -  I called to see Mrs Dudley  Miss Cunningham & Mr Sharp -  Sheridan sick to night.  baby too - with cold.
Wednesday Dec 2d 1862
It is a pretty day but cold.  Sheridan very sick -  he had 4 spasms last night and a very strong one at 2.Oclock to day -  we think caused by indigestion.  Belle left school to day - for to prepare for her visit to Louisville.   Mrs Hilton & Ella came to see me -  I am making Ada a red Velvet cloak -  received a letter from home -  Octave sick to day -
Thursday Dec 3 1862
Sheridan very sick today - so is Belle Eva & Ada -  all with Fever headache & sore throat.  Mrs Thomas called to say Good Bye   so did Mrs. and Miss Rogers -  Mr Badger gone tonight to teachers meeting at Chruch.   Ben Adams very ill - I did not go to the Sherman House party to night
Friday Dec 4th
Mrr Badger bought me a very handsome new trunk - children a little better.  I sent for Dr Small.  he says they have influenza   I wrote home -  Mr Hunt took dinner with us           Brackett Badger went to New York to night.  Mrs. Ludington called to invite us to her home Monday night.
Saturday Dec 5th 1862
It looks like snow -  all the children still with influenza   Mr Hunt dined with us.  I went down town and bought Ada white furs & Jamie a gray fur hat.  Mattie a black velvet - Tom a black fur and Mattie Belle a white velvet hat.  Jamie a gray plush cloak  Mattie a black Lyons cloth  -  children invited to a little Tumleys party - 
Sunday Dec 6th
It is cloudy and looks like snow -  children a little better -  Mr Badger gone to church -  we will not get off to night   children not well enough   Father Badger and Ella called to see me - 
Monday Dec 7th 1862
I was busy all day making preparations to leave to night.   children still very unwell.   Belle with severe earache.   at half past six we had a hack and went to the Depot with five children   2 servants  6 trunks and myself.  I Took leave of Mr Badger and Octave and got into the sleeping Car and started without an escort.   we travelled all night safe -- all slept well but Ada.  she had a bad headache and sick stomach.   I sat up with her almost all night.   at five in the morning we arrived at Indianapolis.  all feeling moderately well -

[ Written below header, above diary entry   Gunter 10]
Tuesday Dec 8th 1862
We went into the reception room at Depot and waited there untill eight Oclock.   then got into the Cars and started for Louisville    we arrived at three O'Clock - almost two hours behind time -   David met us in the Omnibus -  he looks very well -   all at the house were very delighted to see us -   I had when I got into the house a raging sick headache -  my Mother had a fine dinner for us.   but I had to go to bed, and in the morning was well again -
Wednesday Dec 9th
This is Sister Virginia & reception day -   the weather is splendid.   like early September -  it is so warm --  Mrs Nast called to see me - so did Emma Tyler and Sister Mrs Bacon -  also Ellen Morris and Mrs Wm Morris  Miss Mary Rawson & Ellen Frye -  all very peased to see us.  Sister Belle and Brother Tom Shreve took tea with us -  Sheridan has a bad spell to night of Indigestion - I had to vomit him -  I sent for Dr Rogers to see Bella  -  he thinks her trouble is rising in the ear - 
Thursday Dec 10th
I went to bed with raging sore throat and cold in my neck from putting on a thin dress.  Mrs Tucker came to see me  so did Mrs Harrison  Mrs Robt Tyler and daughter  Mrs Charles Johnson -  also Mrs Hopkins and Mrs Eaches - also Mrs David -  at four we went out riding   Mr Gunter came and gave Belle & Eva their first music lesson -  Annie Hunt & Lizzie came by to see Belle   Ellen gone out to spend the night with Ellen Tom
Friday Dec. 11th
Still lovely weather --  my throat very sore -  I had fever all night -  baby much distempered with a new tooth.   little Prathers came to see children   Lin spent the day with us -  also Mattie Belle & Tom.  Mr Ben Adams died at nine Oclock of consumption.  Virginia and I went to Mrs Murphy to be fit for Moire Antique dresses.  Belle received a letter from her Pa   she better to day
Saturday Dec 12th
It is raining.   Mrs Hunt came in to see me and had to stay an hour on account of the rain -  all the children are better -  I still have ulcerated sore throat quite bad -  both Sister Virginia & Belle talk of giving our children parties
Sunday Dec 13th
It is sunny and warm but damp - I went to Christ Church with Belle  Eva  Ada  Sheridan - and my sister Faulds? family -  after church we all went to Mrs Ben Adams to see the corpse -  Mr Adams looked very natural.   he was carried to St. Pauls Church had had a very large funeral.  there were at least 40 in the Procession with the family as mourners -  some relations  some friends   Sister Belle spent the evening here -  Belle is not yet well of her severe cold -  I will write to Mr Badger in the morning - I have seen many of my friends.  they all look well --  report tonight says the federal army is whipped badly at Fredricksburg Virginia

Monday Dec 14th 1862
It is raining to day, and looks like it would all day.  We are all better but cannot go out visiting as we expected.  We all expected to go to unclear & Patti's concert to night - but the rains prevented.  Sister Belles children have Scarlet fever.
Tuesday Dec 15th 1862
It is a lovely day - we all well.  I burned my arm and it is quite swollen.  Sister Belle's children have scarlet fever in earnest - they are doing as well as could be expected.  We are afraid to go to see her.  Mattie Sheridan is here - she is dreadfully deformed.  Sewing? Julia came to see me - she is still in delicate health.  Sallie Hunt also called.
Wednesday Dec 16th 1862
It is quite cold to day - everything is frozen.  Rev Craik and Lady called - also Mrs Judge Pirtle.  We are all well.  I still have my burned arm - it is quite swollen.  Sis's children still in the same condition - children out walking.  I wrote to Mrs Badger there has been a terrible defeat at Fredricksburg Virginia & Burnsides large army - they retreated over the river in haste.
Thursday Dec 17th
This is a beautiful sunny day - we all well but myself - I still have my sore throat and burned arm.  Sister Virginia and I talk of visiting Mattie Sheridan here to spend the day. Sewing? Julia here to see us - children went to see their Aunt Rhoda.  I went visiting.  Saw Heywoods  Lewiss   called on Speeds.  I went to Mrs Beattie's bought a pearl headdress.  Mrs. Angelo Gray called Mrs Peay Mrs Rawson Mrs Harrison.  Our Ellen Mullen came to see us - children took their first dancing from Mrs. Wastell all the children gone to Hunts to dancing school.
Friday Dec 18th
This has been a lovely day - we all well - Sister Belle's still very sick.  My children went out walking - I called on Mrs Rawdon, Tyler, Bacon, Hunts, Powells, Hopkins, Yune's - Hites.  Mrs Ed Wilder Mrs Pirtle Ella Pirtle & Miss Semple called on me.  Mrs. Wastell gave children lessons.  Misses Prathers & Winston called also  Mrs. Blackburn.
Saturday Dec 19
This is a lovely day - I went at eleven o.clock and took my four children to dancing school.  they practised for 2 hours and returned to dinner at three we went again and the hall was crowded to receive and welcome my children.  Mr Wastell had a full band of music also for them   the school has not had a band before this season    children did their fancy dances well - Belle & Elvira wore samon coloured merinos with wide white fold braided in black on skirts.  White Merino Garibaldi's braided in black - this looked well - hair curled down to their waists - white kid slippers &  white gloves - Ada in blue silk ruffled dress blue silk boots.

Saturday continued
Ada danced a hornpipe well.  Sheridan wore a Zouave dress full of gilt buttons on pants & shirt - he looked fine -  he is only over three years old and danced a fancy dance - the Polka   he also danced all the Quadrilles - without mistake - after we returned home children went to Prathers to Tea.
Sunday Dec 20th 1862
It is a very bad day -  I went to Christ Church and took all five children.  I had my baby baptised.    he cried when Mr Craik took him   we named him Alphus Shreve -  Dr Rogers came to see sister Virginia's boy James -   we fear he is taking scarlet fever -  we received news to day from Sister Belle that her children are better - but she is now taking the disease herself, and has been very sick all day -  I wrote her a long letter -  we all well
Monday Dec 2st 1862
This has been a curious day.  it is like April sunshine & shower -  it is quite warm.  Mattie Sheridan spending the day with us.  Virginia & I went down town to buy Christmas gifts --  May Bowles came to get us to give her some toys for the Orphans.  I gave her two dollars and Virginia gave her five cry dolls.   Sister Belle & children doing as well as could be expected.   my children went to Hunts to dancing school.   David & I went over after them -  children went to see the Adams children -
Tuesday Dec 22st 1862
After breakfast Sister Virginia myself and all the children went to the toy shops to buy Christmas -  the weather is mild but damp.   we returned at three O.clock and found my Husband had arrived from Chicago -  he quite well -- after ten Mr. Hunt came to see us -- we all well  -  Sister Belle's children getting well
Wednesday Dec 23rd
After breakfast I went in Sisters Carriage and took all five children and the nurses to visit -  my children called on Mrs Morris.  Hunts Adams Prathers Bells  Musingers Zanes  Hites & Pages.   Heywood  Tuckers  Eashes  Hopkins & cc   after we returned home we went down town and bought Christmas.  Mr Badger gone out -  I made a tree for Sister Belle & children and also one for my children
Thursday Dec 25th [sic]
It has rained almost all day -  at 11 Oclock I went with all the children to Mr Haywoods Church to a Christmas tree for Sunday school children -  my children received gifts of the tree -- everything passed off handsomely   Our tree at home was pretty and my children received many gifts and gave many -- Tucker children gave them lockats -  Sister Belle sent them many many gifts -  we all well -

Friday Dec 26, 1862
It has been a rainy day-and damp- Belle is suffering much to day with Earache- Mrs Haywood Miss Ellen and two children came Mary Breed also called so did Mr & Mrs HemmingMr Mum & Mrs Harrison - Belle suffered so much with earache that Ma sent for Dr. Blogers- he spent a long time with us. Belle had her earache more sever than I ever saw any one- 
Saturday Dec 27th
Eva Ada & Sheridan went to dancing school in the morning I went down street- at 3. O clock Sister Virginia & I went to dancing school and took all the children. they all  danced fancy dances- Belle much better to day - there runs a full house and fine band of music Sheridan amused all by his dancing so cunning children went to Hunts and and spent the evening - 
Sunday Dec 28th
Another lovely day- Weather warm- I went with all the children to Mrs Heywoods CHurch- after church went to see Mrs Page- Sewing Julia & Fredricka came to see us Josh Speus? came to see children- Mr & Mrs Danforth came to see me- my nurse Ellen sick to night- intense excitement prevails in the city to day- John Morgan- has had a fight 20 miles from here- and taken many of the Federals- they are again fortafying the City- Mr Badger gone out - 
Monday Dec 29th
It is glorious weather- after breakfast I took a hack and went to return visits- called on Mrs Morris- Gray- Jane - Peary^ Hast. Hunt. Henning- Elliott- Mason- and then returned home children went to say good Bye to some friends- my Sister Mrs Faulds much to the surprise of us all- made up her mind to return with me- and in two hours she and her two children were packed- at one we got into the Omnibus and started for Chicago- my Mother was sad at parting with us- we got along nicely with our trip until half way when baby Alpheus Shreve had the colic- after we got into the sleeping car at Indianapolisa all went right- and we reached Chicago at ten O. clock Teusday morning
Teusday Dec 30th
The weather here is mild for the season- home looks very pleasant- our lake not frozen- we took dinner unpacked and retired much fatigued- all well.
Wednesday Dec. 31st
This is a lovely day- just cold enough to be bracing- I started out at ten O clock in a hack to let my friends know that I had returned- I called on many and returned later at night- Inviting them to my house on Thursday- sister went with me-

Thursday Jan 1st 1863
Weather not very good -  I arose early and arranged things for my new years reception.  My boy Sheridan awoke with a swelled cheek.  Eva very unwell with cold.   my best servant and cook Nancy sick in bed -  My sister, myself, man Oliver  Rebeckah, Isaac and Louisa  all my servants - were very busy making good things.  Mr Badger made the Egg Nog.   It was very fine   at ten O.clock everything was ready - and friends began to come.   Jim waited on the door -  servants all black.  I received very many gentlemen -  had a fine bunch of music playing all day -  3 round tables in the parlour -  filled with good things.  in the afternoon ladies and their husbads called.   and at seven many young ladies & Gentlemen arrived and we danced untill 2 Oclock in the morning  -  at eleven we had a fine supper -  every one seemed to enjoy themselves.   we had a fine time -  Eva quite sick -  it rains
Friday Jan 2nd
It looks like snow.  Eva a little better.   I received a letter from Pa -- all well at Louisville.  I very busy arranging things all to day.  children feasting themselves  I wrote home -
Saturday Jan 3rd
This is a very pleasant day   Sister Virginia & I going shopping   we returned late.   all well but Eva   she and Sheridan I think have mumps
Sunday Jan 4th
It is a beautiful day.  I went to Church with Mr Badger in the afternoon I went with him.  Albert Octave & Brackett to Father Badgers.   the boys dined with us.  Alice Hilton is spending day with us -  also night
Monday Jan 5th 1863
Mrs Warner - also Miss Redmond came to see me.  we all well but Eva & Sheridan  they complaining.  I went down street for a little while.  Sister Licinia  Ellen & Melville took tea with us   Mr Badger has getlemen here talking about Unitarian sunday school.  he gone out with them.  Alice will stay all night
Tuesday Jan 6th 1863
This is another fair day -  we all well -  Sister Virginia Mr. Badger & myself went to Mr Browns daughters wedding - there was a large crowd - everything passed off nicely  -  they were married by Rev Patterson   she received many gifts.  Mrs unclear my  home & Miss Mark called
Wednesday Jan 7th 1863
Sister Licinia not here to day -  weather good  - I went to Mrs Beechers church Sociable.   we danced and enjoyed it,   Mr Badger received a pretty book mark from Miss H. Clark -
Thursday Jan 8th
Weather looks like snow.  Mrs Peck, Mrs Jones called  also Misses Forsyths,  Mrs & Miss Gurnee, Mrs Morris  Mrs Mc Cormick   Mrs Winston -  Mr Badger going to Church -  David came this morning

Friday Jan 9th 1863
This is a pretty day- Mrs Honore called  also Mrs Vandervoort. Miss Goodrich Miss M. A Rice & Mrs Mittenberger-   I went down town- after tea Mr Badger David Octave & myself all went to the negro Minstrels  children all well- 
Saturday Jan 10th 1863
Sister Virginia & I took a hack and went shopping this morning    we all well-   Mr Badger going to Unitarian meeting to night    cannon fired this evening- I have not yet heard for what purpose-
Sunday Jan 11th 1863
It is bright over head, but bad under foot- I went with David to Unitarian Church - the Badger boys came to see us after dinner   I went with David to Mr Badgers church- to the meeting of the Sunday school Union- there was a large crowd - Mr  Badger is President of the meeting- we all well  - I wrote home to day-
Monday Jan 12th 1863
It is again bright over head - many are skating on the basin before our door- yet it is warm for Chicago and no sleighing yet-  Virginia & I took a Carriage and went to many houses inviting our friends to our house to morrow night to the Grass hopper Club- Miss Waller and Miss Morse called to day - also Misses Gurnee - to night we are all busy ripening some beautiful apples    we all wel l- I bought a white Moire Antique silk to day- I received an invitation to day for the mite? Society- also an invitation to Mrs Sturges party and one to the Bachelors ball thursday nigh t- 
Tuesday Jan 13th 1863
It is raining and looks as if it would continue so all day   I am very busy arranging things for our Grasshopper Club to night- at eight 0.clock I had every thing finished- children dressed and all ready  - the company collected at nine   there were a great many here- ladies in full dress- everything passed off handsomely- there was but one thing to mar my pleasur e- that was the boldness of one young lady my Sister & Brotherinlaw- Mr Faulds were here- we are all well all left at two O.clock- we had a nice supper-
Wednesday Jan 14th 1863
It is cold- I went to dress maker to be fit for my white Moire Antique dress.  bought a red velvet headdress - at nine O.clock Brother David Faulds Mr Badger Octave & myself all went - they had a fine supper and every thing passed off handsomely-  we danced a great deal.  it is the finest supper I have been to here in Chicago- we all well-  baby getting 4 new teeth.

Thursday Jan 15th 1863
It commenced snowing this morning early- and continued all day- Mrs Duffield & Mrs Tyler called- It snowed so fast & thick that I made them stay to dinner- Mr A.D. Hunt also dined with us- the snow fell in such quantities as to cover everything with snow I think 7 or 8 inches deep- someplaces it was knee deep- at nine O.clock Octave and I went to the Bachelors ball at the Tremont Hotel- we took Fannie Goodwin with us- there was about one hundred persons in the club-  we had a fine evening I danced all the time- I met a Mr Gillett of New York . 
Friday Jan 16th 1863
The snow has ceased- it is very thick -  sleighs are passing by the hundreds- Sister Virginia & I were invited by Mr Badger & Mr Hunter to go sleighing   they brought the large Tremont sleigh for us- I was out and could not go-  Sister could not go home on account of the tracks being covered with snow- I bought two coral breastpins and sent them to Tuckers children- 
Saturday Jan 17-
Still sleighing all the time Sister Virginia boy James has this morning the Mumps- he has taken them from Sheridan- and Sister thinks she has them too- much to my surprise and deep regret I noticed the death in the paper of Clara Wheeler- a young girl of sixteen- who lives near us- she died of scarlet fever- she was a lovely girl her loss will be keenly felt by her family-
Sunday Jan 18-
It is beautiful over head- but the snow is melting fast and it is sloppy- Sister Virginia is a sight this morning from mumps   Ada is sick too- I do not know wether she has it or not- all well but the three with mumps- I went with David to Bishop Whitehouse,s church at the West end- was much pleased   Mr Badger gone to Unitarian - Sister Virginia & family left for Louisville to night- mumps and all- her husband had to return- Mr Badger gone to night church- Clara Wheeler was buried at three O.clock Mrs Mrs Fred Tuttle & Mrs Burton called to day- ( I mean Saturday) 
Monday Jan 19th 1863.
It looks like rain- Miss Morris & Miss Waller came to invite us to Mrs Gilmans to the Grass hopper club- on Friday- Hannah Keith came to see us- our serving girl- we all well- Ada better to day   It rains and we will have to give up the Philharmonic Concert to night-   Mr Badger at home- children went down town-
Tuesday Jan 20th
It looks like rain- we all well- Mr L.U. Badger & Octave went to the mite society- Mr Badger did not go to bible? class- because I was going out- we have Mr Hunt to dinner every day-

Wednesday Jan 21st 1863
This is an ugly day- the snow is melting- we are all in health-  I had a call from Frank Honore & Mrs Herfort after ten- at 4. O.clock I went to Father Badgers with Belle & Eva - we stayed all evening- returned at 11 O.clock
Thursday Jan 22nd
I received a call from Misses Steele to day also Mrs Ludington & Miss Messinger. Mr Hunt took dinner with us-  we all well   I dressed some dolls for the children.   after ten Mr Badger Octave & Mr Munn went to the Theatre with me - to see  Florence. 
Friday Jan 23rd
It rains to day- we all well- Eva got better of her headache   Mrs Peck came to see me to day-   we are going to the Grass hopper Club to night-  at Mrs Morris,s.  at two O.clock Ella came and brought her Bandbox with clothes in it for the club- we went in a hack about 9 O.clock and found many there- all in party dress- we had a nice time returned at two in the morning - I danced all the time Mr Hunt & Munn left to night
Saturday Jan 24th
It is a pleasant day- all of us dressing dolls- namely Ella myself Belle Eva & Ellen   after dinner I went to Miss Van Pyle to order an Opera cloak of white merino- children all went with me- Ella gone out home- I received an invitation to Mrs H.C. Stone,s  party - received a letter from Sister Virginia- she sick from mumps 
Sunday Jan 25
It is a lovely day- we all well- I went to Church and took Belle Eva & Ada- after church Father Badger took them all out to his home- I after dinner went after them with Sheridan returned early- Mr Badger gone to poor school- he brought Belle & Eva home- after Tea he went to church- I wrote to Sister Belle-
Monday Jan 26
I received a letter from Father - I took a hack and went with Octavius to see Mrs Wm Sturges- spent a pleasant half hour- then went to Sherman House to see Mrs Field- Sister Licinia & Cousin Arianna dined with me- Miss Delia Gurnee & Miss Amelia came to see me- also Misses Clark- Mrs Goodrige- after ten we went and spent evening with Mrs Thomas - our ministers wife- children began school to day
Tuesday Jan 27
We all well- I went down street shopping- Miss Waller called to say good Bye- we are invited to a party at Mrs Dunhams on Thursday- Mr Redmond called to see us- also Mr Fisher Florence still with is- little Clarks came to see children - they went after tea to see Ella Walker-
Wednesday Jan 28-
weather fair- to day I invited Mr & Mrs Field Mr & Mrs Hilton Mr & Mrs Thomas to tea- they call came- we had a pleasant evening- all well- they left late.

Calls
Thursday Jan 29th 1863
This is my reception day - I saw miss Eva & Miss Walker- Mrs L.A Smith. Mrs Cobb Mr Connery & Mrs Peck Mrs Daniel Thompson & Miss Ward- Mrs Brandon Bureley Mrs Clarke- Mrs Bently- Mrs Reutter Miss Reutter & Mrs Turnly- Mrs Burton Mrs Isham- Mrs Tureman- Mrs S.A. Goodwin & Miss Goodwin Mrs Dudley & Miss Cunnigham Mrs Charles unclear Mrs Updike & Miss Skinner Misses Harmon Mrs Heywood- after ten- Mr Badger Octave & myself took a hack and went 6 mils to Mrs H.C. Stone,s party - I sent my regret to Mrs Dunhams
Friday Jan 30-
This is a good day- Ella took Florence home- Mr Bigelow & Mr Ward called- we received invitations to day- to a party at Forsythe- one at Mrs P.G. Adams and one at Mrs Goodridge,s after tea we went to the Sherman house to see Mrs Field- they had a dance there and we stayed untill eleven- I danced in my cloak & bonnet-
Saturday Jan 31th
Good weather- I went  shopping - children went visiting- called to see Mrs W Sturges- Mrs Flint Mrs Thompson. Mrs Field & Mrs Thomas- after tea Mr Badger & I went to a Temperance lecture- delivered by Goff- Belle went too- 
Sunday Feb 1st 1863
This is Sheridan,s birthday- he is four years old- we all well- I took a Carriage and took Mr & Mrs Field to Mr Thomas,s church- the children went too- it is cold to night - Mr Badger gone on the west side to the Union meeting- Octave not well-
Monday Feb 2nd
To night we are invited to the mite society at Mrs Adams- Mr & Mrs Field are coming to our house to play Euchre- they came and we played until twelve- we all well- I went down town shopping Belle. Eva & Ada went in a hack to a party at Mrs Dunhams dressed in white tarletans and wreaths on head- white kid gloves Mr Badger gone to church-
Teusday Feb 3rd 1863
This has been a lovely day- but cold- I went to dress makers to have my magenta merino dress fit trimmed with black fold braided with white arranged my party dress and went to Mrs Goodridge,s at nine O.clock. wore white shallic trimmed with blue- spent a delightful evening danced all the time-
Wednesday Feb 4th 
It is very cold & windy- we all well- received a letter from home Ella Badger came in and stayed all night. we went to Mrs Millards and spent the evening- danced some- Ella & Octave & Belle also went- it snowed in the night- 
Thursday Feb 5th 1863
It snows to day- we all well- they are cutting the Ice in the Lake and carrying it off- received party invitations to Mrs Daniel Thompsons for next Thursday- Mr Field left town- Mrs Field still, home, Mrs Fassett,s party to night

Rebekah 10th
Friday Feb 6th 1863
It is very warm & Sunshiny to day -- snow fell fast yesterday -- but it is now melting fast.  Ella still with us -- Belle has had another small boil in her ear -- but still goes to school -- Mrs Field & Mr Hunt spent evening with us last night -- we played cards -- I will write home to day -- Mrs Beecher & Mrs Updike called.  Misses Forsyths party to night -- we attended  had a nice time -- I danced all the time  Octave went with us -- Invited to a party of the M?ite society at Briggs house --
Saturday Feb 7th 1863
It is warm to day -- snow melting -- busy all morning seeing children have their bath -- I also took mine -- Mrs Horton & daughters called -- in the afternoon  I went and took all the children to Father Badgers to a candy pulling -- stayed untill eleven O.clock -- received a letter from home -- Mr & Mrs Feild called last night -- invited to Mrs Daniel Thompsons party
Sunday Feb 8th 1863
It snows and thaws to day -- I did not go to church -- Mr Badger did -- we all in health--  Mr Badger gone to his Fathers -- and will go to church to night -- I wrote to day to Virginia & Siss -- and will write to Pa -- will also write to Pauline Myers of Switzerland  our french girl
Monday Feb 9th
Mrs William Johnson called  also Mrs D. Gurnee & daughters -- it has rained almost all day -- I sent my regret to the Masquerade at Mrs Franklins -- also to the Briggs House -- we all well --
Teusday Feb 10th
I took a Carriage and went visiting -- called to see Miss Tucker Mrs Gurnee -- Mrs F G Adams -- Mrs Goodridge. Miss Morse -- Miss Rice  Mrs Bronson -- Mrs Burton -- Mrs Fred Tuttle -- Mrs Dolittle -- Miss ? Cunningham & Miss Mack -- returned at four O.clock -- Mrs Howard Mrs Skinner & Mrs Stone called -- also Mrs F Fleetwood & Mrs Hosmer -- Mrs Hilton took tea with us -- Rebekah our black girl left to day wanted higher wages
Wednesday Feb 11th
It is mild to day -- we all well -- Miss Flint called to see me  I went to see Mrs Feild and Mrs Thomas -- children all went skating this afternoon first time this winter -- Mr Bigelow called to see us to night -- we played cards untill late --Ella & Ariannia came with Father Badger to see Octave & Bracket dressed for Masquerade -- Octave was dressed handsomely in velvet & satin -- Don [[A Court Jape in different handwriting]] Bracket went as old Monk -- they looked well --
Thursday Feb 12th
It snowed last night -- and there is on a level three inches of snow  sleighs are out in number -- they are still cutting ice in the basin -- the street is blocaded up with wagons -- we are going to night to Mrs Daniel Thompsons party -- I think we will take Mr & Mrs Feild with us -- Mr Hunt took dinner with us -- we are all well -- I received a letter from home --

Matilda Feb 16.         Music lesson Feb 19th.            Calls 16
Friday Feb 13th
This is a very fair day over head but sloppy under feet -- I went down town and bought a new net spencer -- Miss Van Tryl made it   at nine we went to the Sherman House to a little party given by Mr Feild to his friends -- we stayed untill two O.clock  had a splendid time -- we all well
Saturday Feb 17th
It rains now -- we all well -- Mr & Mrs Feild came round after tea and played Euchre untill one O. clock -- we had a little Oyster supper -- and had a pleasant evening --
Sunday Feb 15th
It is a lovely day -- Mr Badger & children gone to Mr Thomas church -- I went to Dr Pratt,s Trinity church -- at four O. clock Mr Badger and I went to the Sherman House to say Good Bye to Mr & Mrs Feild -- who leave for New York to night -- Mr Badger gone to night church --
Monday Feb 16th 1863
It is a lovely morning -- we all well -- Mrs B. F. Sherman called to see me -- I will write home to day  Mrs W. B Young, and Mrs Charles Gray called   Mr Hunt took dinner with us.  I went with Licinia & Ella to see Mrs Murphy--Mrs Winston & Mrs Wm Mc Cormick -- I will send my regret to the Tremont party to night -- we all received Valentines from Louisville  children also -- called to see Mrs S. S. Hayes -- baby one year old to day --
Teusday Feb 17 -- 1863
This has been a lovely day -- I took a Carriage and went visiting  called on Mrs Updike Mrs Peck & Jones -- Mrs Wm H  Brown -- Mrs Harmon  Mrs Willard -- Mrs Daniel Thompson  Mrs King & Schoofenberg Mrs Bentley Mrs Gray                      -- we all well -- I sent my regret to the Mite party at the Sherman -- Octave Walter Father Badger gone -- I did not go -- John Hilton took tea with us --
Wednesday Feb 18th 1863
This has been a dreary looking day -- we all very  well -- I received a wedding card from Mr?s Andrew Low, inviting us to the wedding of Florence M. Low -- to J. Robert Dupuy -- I went down town with Ada & Sheridan to buy him a Hobby Horse -- Mr Hunt was here to dinner -- Mademoiselle De Pelgram? called to get Belle for a  scholar -- in Music -- she will begin to morrow -- the Mite party last night a success -- received letters from home -- children have received many Valentines -- Eva has ten--
Thursday Feb 19th
It is a gloomy looking day -- I went to my dress makers -- it has rained and snowed this afternoon -- we all well -- Belle took a music lesson from Miss De Pelgrim? this afternoon -- I did not go last night to Mrs Harmons -- my baby one year old -- has eight teeth through -- makes no effort at walking yet -- can almost talk -- has very curly hair --  Misses Fleetwood called also Mrs Laflin --

Friday Feb 20th 1863
The snow is all melting - sun shining brightly. Our cow tossed up our coloured man Brown this morning and cut his head and leg - but not severely.  [...] all well. I will write home today. Ellen took dinner with us. I sent a box to Louisville and my regrets to Florence Low,s Wedding.
Saturday Feb 21st 1863
This has been a windy day. Children took their usual bath. [...] came to invite Belle & Eva to a candy pulling at their house this afternoon. They went. It is blowing severely. All well but Ada. She complaining a little, the children had a little party last night. Ada ate too much. Belle & Eva went to the party - returned at ten o,clock.
Sunday Feb 22nd 1863
This is a bad day, and I will not go to church. Belle went with her father. I wrote home. Mr Hunt took dinner with us. Then he and Mr. Badger went walking. The ground covered with snow. I went with Belle & Eva to Father Badger. Mr. Badger came after us. I brought Ella home with me and Alice. They stayed all night.
Monday Feb 23rd 1863
This is a lovely day over head, but sloppy under foot. Ella and I went to the office to meet Sister [...] & Florence Cousins, Arianna Cutts and her two little boys. They came from the West End to spend day with me. Washington's birthday was celebrated today by a long procession of soldiers, Butchers and fire department. Mr. Wilton, Mr. Generett, Walter Milton, Albert Badger, Octave  Bracket Badger, Father Badger & Horace Badger all spent day with me. We played cards danced and played a number of games, to a later hour at night. We had a fine time.
Tuesday Feb 24th
This is a bright day.  I went down town with all the children.  I bought a lot f stockings, also new sun bonnets for children.  Mrs Arthur came to see me, also Mrs Clyde, Mrs Murray Nelsons  Miss Gurnee to invite Octave to her house on thursday night   Hannah came to day.  
Wednesday Feb 25th
I received a latter from Sister Belle.  Alice Hilton still with us.  Miss Rutter and Brother Charles called.  Miss Rittell called  Mrs J. B. Vaughn& Mrs Wm Alcott  Mrs Manierre.  I went visiting - called to see Mrs Hadduck, Mrs Heydock, Mrs Leduc, Mrs Barney  Mrs H. B. Skinner, Mrs Moulten -   it now rains  -  Mr Hunt here to dinner.
I am visited by Mr Hunt to go to the Theatre   Mr Hilton took Tea with us.   we played cards all evening
Thursday Feb 26
This is a dreary looking day.   Mrs Wm Waller called  also Mrs Lamb.  Miss Justina Walker called to day to say Good Bye as she leaves to night to nurse the sick soldiers.  I went to the Theater to see Cubas?  - Mr & Mrs Pesy called

Friday Feb 27-
It is a lovely day- quite warm- a large Vessel came in, the first this season- Mrs Vandertvogt called, I went down street- Alice went home this evening- children gone to a party at Harmons. Mr Badger gone for them, Mr Hunt here to night- we played cards- my baby has sore mouth- Mr John Drake married to Miss Coric- I received cards to day-
Saturday Feb 28-
It looks like rain- children busy making toffe candy I went down street- after we went to Murdocks lecture, but he did not not read on account of sickness- so we returned home-
Sunday March 1st 1863
This is an ugly day- past snow and rain- Mr Badger gone to Church- Mr Hunt and Mr Henning here this Afternoon and took tea with us- they remained untill ten O.clock- I received a letter from David- Peter Donegan dead who married Maggie Coleman
Monday March 2nd 1863
We all in health- I went down town shopping   in the afternoon  I unclear -  Belle took her music lesson
Tuesday March 3rd 1863
It looks like snow- we all well- Eva gone to get Dr Godfrey to straighten her tooth, Mrs Edwin Hunt & daughter called, Mr A Bigelow called-
Wednesday March 4th 1863

It looks like rain- after dinner Belle & Eva went out to the Father Badger's to a candy pulling - it being Ella's birthday- after tea Mr Badger and I went out- it very unclear. Mr Hunt & Hemming here to dinner.

Thursday March 5th 
It is a cloudy day- no one came- I cut out childrens new black merino shirts- braided with Jewrlery.  sent a box to Louisville with some things for sister- received as a present from Sister Virginia beautiful black merino band for my Magenta merino dress the band braided with white silk braid-
Friday March 6th 1863
This is a beautiful day  all of us well but Sheridan - he sick with cold   Mrs Ezra L. Sherman called to see me- I received letters from home- I went to Mrs Daniel Thompsons to the Sewing Society   we had a very nice dinner- I danced every Sett- Mr Hunt called to see us- Mr Hilton and Octavius- both Brotherinlaws went to New York to night - Mr Hemming 
Saturday March 7-
This is a busy day children receiving little friends- Eva going to Dentist- Belle sprained her foot a little- we all well- received letter from home- finishing childrens black Garabaldis

Sunday March 8th
It snows and is wet -- Mr Badger gone to Church -- I wrote home -- Mr Hunt took dinner with us -- and told us Good Bye -- he leaves to night for Louisville -- Mr Badger and Eva went out to his Fathers at west end -- Eva took cold -- after tea Mr Badger went to church --
Monday March 9th
Sheridan not well -- he is in bed with fever -- Eva came home from school with headache -- all the rest well -- I will not go out to day -- Mrs Ezra Sherman called -- Mr Charles Gray and Mr Willard spent evening with us,
Teusday March 10th
It is a pretty day -- I went down street -- Sheridan better -- Eva gone to school. Mrs P U? Murphy called with Mr J. K? Fisher Mrs Flint called -- I received a box from Louisville brought to me by Mrs Murphy my old dress maker -- who has just arrived   she thinks of settling here -- Mr & Mrs Thomas came to tea -- we had a nice supper -- after tea Dr & Mrs Willard scratched out Mc Vicker called also Mr A. Bigelow we had a pleasant evening --
Wednesday March 11th
Sheridan up and dressed -- all of us well -- I took a Carriage and Ada and I went calling -- made many visits all on the North side -- we are at home to night -- I called to see Mrs Wm Fleetwood, Mrs Hosmer, Mrs Trueman?, Mrs Dexter Mrs Dudley Mrs Rogers, Mrs Fenton, both families of Goodwins Mrs M. O Walker
Thursday March 12th
This is my reception day -- we are all well -- Weather very good --
Friday March 13th
I visited all day -- took Ada with me -- called only on Mich Ave -- called on Mrs Peck -- Miss Gurnee -- Mrs Cobb -- Mrs Tuttle Mrs Beecher -- Mrs Sherman -- Mrs Farnham -- Miss Skinner -- Mrs D Gurnee -- Mrs Clark. Mrs Wm Johnson -- Mrs Nelson -- Mrs Barner? -- Mrs Maniere, children went to Flints to a candy pulling -- Mr Badger and I called for them --
Saturday March 14th
This is a bright day -- Mrs Murphy my dress maker came from Louisville to see me to day -- my children went visiting -- they called on many children -- in the afternoon  we all went to Mirasole,s dancing school -- we go to night to Theatre to see Cubas.  Mr Smith has rented this house of Mr Burch,s and we will have to get another, Mr Burch wants 25 hundred dollars for it this year -- we went to see Cubas, took Belle, Eva & Ada -- all our family from west end were there.  She played the French spy --
Sunday March 15th
It is a lovely day -- I went to Unitarian Church took Belle, Eva & Ada -- received letters from stating the illness of Brother Thomas Shreve -- also his son Tom -- Mr B gone to night church --

Monday 16th 1863.
This is a beautiful day.  I went down town with Ada to Mr Gards -- and had her Photograph taken -- then went shopping untill late -- Belle & Eva went to Nellie Clyde,s to a party -- Mrs James Miller called
Teusday March 17th
It was very sunny early this morning -- but it now rains -- there had been nearly all day a large procession parading up and down the Avenue -- celebrating St Patricks day -- the rain fell on them all the time -- after tea we played cards.
Wednesday March 18th
I rose early -- beautiful day -- took Sheridan and went to Photographic Office.  Sheridan stood well -- hope to get a good picture -- Mrs Winston & Mrs Sharp. called to see me -- we played cards after tea --Mrs Billings called also Miss Patrick --
Thursday March 19th
This is a cloudy day -- Mrs Steele Mrs Cunnnghame & Miss Mack called -- we all well -- received letters from home -- confirming the illness of Mr?s T T. Shreve by Brother inlaw with Erysipelus -- has two Physicians -- face in a dreadful condition -- James Faulds my little Nephew broke out on Monday with Scarlet fever that is very bad on account of his Ma assisting in Nursing Mr s? Shreve  My Mother is taking care of him -- little Mattie his Sister -- who has Spine disease -- has sore throat -- but not the fever yet -- I am troubled at the news
Friday March 20th 1863.
It snowed, blew, and hailed last night -- and this morning there was on the ground about 2 inches of snow -- and it blows violently -- rains and sleet -- but children would go to school -- I have been busy all day Sewing -- this afternoon I wrote to our French girl in Switzerland -- received a letter from home -- brother Shreve still very ill -- little Nephew Faulds quite sick with Scarlet fever -- Mr Badger reading to night one of Dickens stories for me and the children -- we all well --
Saturday March 21st
This is a gloomy day -- raining and snowing a little -- cutting out work.  we all well -- children making candy -- Ella Walker and Gussie Stone here with them --
Sunday March 22nd
It rained early this morning, I went to Church -- with Mr Badger  Father Badger came home with me -- I wrote home to Pa and Sister Belle -- Brackett and Albert Badger here -- Mr Badger went after dinner to his Fathers -- I received letters from home stating Mr Shreve a little better -- but my Nephew Jamie very sick with scarlet fever -- also their little black girl Kate with it -- my baby getting his first double teeth -- he is very well -- and keeps his immense weight -- of thirty pounds --

Monday March 23rd 1863
This is one of the most misty foggy days I ever saw -- every now and then raining -- we all well -- I went down street and bought a paper doll for to send to Jaimie -- there was a very large fire to night -- I was a store that belonged to J. H.? Dunham.
Teusday March 24th 1863.
This is another gloomy day -- Eva not well -- I kept her at home -- I cut out work in the morning for my Seamstress -- then after dinner I went up Michigan Avenue to see a house on Harmon Court -- then on Wabash to see Alex. White,s house -- it is turning cold and snowing slightly.
Wednesday March 25th
Another gloomy day, but dry -- Eva better -- she is a little billious -- Belle is preparing herself for the examinations? next Thursday or rather Friday at her school -- after Tea Mr Badger and I went to see Mrs Flint and her daughter from New York -- Mrs Dortie? -- while we were there -- Mr Hoswell and young Ely, called to see us -- childrens new light gaiters and thick boots just come home from Mrs Buffum? -- Mr Hunt came from Louisville to day --
Thursday March 26
This is a glorious day -- sun so bright, air so exhilerating -- we have not house in view yet -- Mother Badger walked in this morning from the West End -- took dinner with us -- and walked out again it was quite an undertaking for her -- Mrs Dr Byford -- Miss Byford and Mrs Leonard called to day -- also Cousin Brackett Badger with Mrs Judge Higgins -- Eva better.  Belle took her Music lesson -- Mr Hunt called and spent the evening with us -- received letters from home -- they report that all are better -- Belle is going to speak at school to morrow -- Hannah dressed a boy doll for Belle to day --
Friday March 27th
This is a lovely day -- Ada went to school with Belle to look on -- Eva very stiff in her limbs with Rheumatism -- I went down town with Sheridan shopping -- after tea Mr Hunt called and took Mrs Hilton Mr Badger and myself all out to the Negro Minstrels -- we enjoyed it much -- after leaving the Hall -- Mr Hunt took us all to Mrs Johnsons to get a Supper -- we had stewed Oysters -- Champagne -- Sherbet and Cakes -- we returned home at eleven O. clock -- Sister Hilton stayed in town all night with us.
Saturday March 28th
This has been a chilly day -- Eva is so crippled that she cannot walk -- all the rest well -- Sister Hilton and I went shopping after breakfast -- I returned home at three -- sent for Dr Small.  he says Eva has Rheumatic fever -- after dinner I called to see the bride Mrs John Drake at the Tremont -- Walter Hilton gave me his picture

Sunday March 29th 1863
This is a beautiful day -- I went to Church and took Belle Ada & Sheridan.  Eva better this morning -- I will write home -- Belle and her Father gone to West End --
Monday March 30th
This morning at eight O.clock -- Rev Thomas & lady came and took breakfast with us.  at eleven we all went walking with them  after our walk we took street Cars.  and Mr Thomas and wife Ade Sheridan & myself all went out to the City limits for a ride -- after that we separated she for her home and I for mine -- Mr Badger and myself went out to Mr Honore,s to tea -- there we met -- Father Badger and Ella -- Sister Hilton coudin? Generett & Husband -- Mr & Mrs bRyant -- Mr & Mrs Harrison -- Mrs Bronson & Sister Miss Mulker -- Frank Honore -- we had a nice supper -- after that we danced untill late -- missed the Car -- and Frank Honore brought us all in at two O. clock in double seated Buggy -- we had a charming time -- moonlight and not very cold --
Teusday March 31st 1863
This is a sunny morning -- but in the night it snowed a little  at two O. clock to day -- we go to see Dollie Dutton -- and take all the children, but Eva, she not well enought -- Dollie is eleven years old -- weighs 15 pound and can easily walk under Gen-- Tom Thumbs arm -- she is a little curiosity -- we all in health  after tea Mr Bigelow came in and took tea with us -- we played cards untill late -- Belle has severed Earache to night -- Mr & Mrs Thomas went with us to see Dollie --
Wednesday April 1st 1863.
This is April fools day -- my little ones are having much fun -- Belle,s ear better -- she off to school -- I went shopping with Licinia & Ella -- at 12-- we went with Mr Hunt to Carbutts Gallery -- to see some fine Stereoscopic views -- which we enjoyed --  Mr Hunt came in after tea -- and we spent a pleasant evening --
Thursday April 2nd 1863.
This is a bright morning -- after breakfast I took a Carriage and went with Eva to Dearborn Seminary -- to Belle,,s examination, Eva being unwell for some days -- did not take part in the exercises -- as was intended -- I enjoyed it much -- Belle did well -- at three O. clock. I went with Mr Badger Mr Honore and Mr Hayes -- to see a very handsome house on the West side -- it belongs to Mr Hayes -- It is a beautiful house -- Mr Badger talks of buying it -- after Tea -- Henry Wheeler came in -- and we spent a pleasant evening -- received letters from home -- all better --
Friday April 3rd
I went with the children to the Seminary this morning to see examination of the young ladies -- it was good, and the Calisthenics were very fine -- all were in bloomer Costume -- after Tea we went again to a literary meeting -- it was also good -- the young ladies read many compositions -- we had also Music

Saturday April 4 1863
This is a beautiful day I went downtown then came home to dinner at one Oclock. Mr. Hunt, Mrs. Hilton, Ella and myself went house hunting then downtown shopping.  Children went again to see Dollie Dulton? took Ella Walker with them. After that we all wen to Toy Shop.  Bought a walking doll, tow black yarn? dolls and one china doll.  Then bought a lot of cakes.   Mr/ And Mrs. Hilton, Ella Walter Hilton & Mr. Hunt all came and took tea with us.  After tea we played cards, ate cakes and ice cream and at 12 Oclock separated.  
Sunday, April 5th 1863
Another lovely day.  We all in health.  I went to Mr. Thomas's Church, took Belle, Eva, Ada & Sheridan.  Belle and her father went out to the West End to Father Badger's.  Mr. Hunt and Walter Hilton spent the afternoon with me. Mr. Hunt stayed to tea.  Letter from home state that little Mattie Fields? has scarlet fever and is unclear weak.  She is my little niece that has spine disease.  I fear it will go hard for her.  Her brother James and two colored servants just recovering from it.  I wrote three letters home and sent photographs to them.
Monday April 6th 1863
it is a sunny day but cold and windy.  The dust is very bad.  I went to the office, met Mr. Hunt there.  He invited Mr. Badger Mr. Hilton, Octavius and myself to go get oysters.  We did.  He went to Mr. Johnson's, had champagne and enjoyed ourselves much.  It was quite a supper.  We all bought unclear of Marsh Mellow Candy.  I sent to Mattie Faulds? by Mr. Hunt a walking doll also a doll in an an arm chair nursing a boy to Jamie?, one also to Mattie Belle.  I went to the depot and saw Mr. Hunt go.  Belle and Eva have Tilly Spaulding , Ella Walker and Gussie stone to tea.  After tea Mr. Bigelow came in and we played cards and drank champagne.  Belle had cake and candy for her little guests.  Mrs. Jennie Stewart and Mrs. Williams came to see me.
Tuesday April 7th 1863
This is a bright day. I went downtown a little while shopping with children.  After tea I went with Octavius, Eva, Bella & Ada to the Philharmonic Concert.  Mr. Badger had a headache and did not go.
Wednesday April 8th
Again it is fair and pleasant.  I received letters from home -they all better.  I cut out work all morning for my sewing girl and then in the afternoon took Belle and went to see Ma. Walken's house in Terrace block but she declines to unclear.  We met Sister Hilton in a hack.  Went with her to the office then went down town and bought some worsted patterns for Virginia.  After tea, I went with Mr. Badger & Mr. Bigelow and Octavius to see Mrs. Brandon & her sister Mrs. Meckler.  After we left there we went to Mrs. Johnson's  and had a Champagne supper.  Mr. Bigelow treated us all

Thursday April 9th 1863.
To day is as lovely as May -- we all well -- at twelve O.clock I took Belle & Eva and went to the laying of the corner Stone of the Unitarian Church -- It was very impressive -- many were there -- Miss Schoofenberg came to see me -- I wrote home --to night the children had Louisa & Florence Clark, Lilly Harmon Lena Flint and Nelly Clyde to tea -- they enjoyed themselves --
Friday April 10th 1863.
It look like rain early this morning -- and really has, often to day sprinkled  I went shopping for a head dress and did not find one -- we all well  Belle & Eva spent Afternoon with Emily Gilman -- at eight O. clock -- Mr Badger, Octave and Mr Bigelow and myself all went out to Mr Bryan,s to the Grasshopper Club -- it rained some -- we enjoyed our evening very much -- returned home in our Carriage at two? in the morning  at seven in the evening there was a large fire -- and at two next morning it broke out again -- we rode up to the fire with Mr Bigelow  it was an awful sight -- yet very grand -- the stores were owned by D. J? Ely. and filled with Whiskey & Alcohol.  Mr Badger/my Husband lost Six hundred barrels of flour -- but it was insured.
Saturday April 11th 1863.
It is a bright day -- at one O. clock -- I went to Mr Gards Photograph gallery -- took Belle Eve Ada & Sheridan with me -- had all their pictures taken -- one group of the three girls -- Mrs Walter Gurnee & Miss Delia called -- after tea we all played cards -- letters from home state that they all are better --
Sunday April 12th
Again we have fine weather -- we all in health this morning -- I went to Mr Thomas,s church -- took all four children with me -- Mr Tuttle preached  he invited the Unitarian Sociable to our house on Wednesday night  after dinner Mr Badger myself and four children all went to Father Badgers.  Walter took tea with us -- I wrote home --
Monday April 13th
It is a bright day -- and we all feel well -- Belle & Eva start to day to school again -- their two weeks vacation being over -- I am going down town this afternoon -- Navigation is open -- and our Lake is a busy scene with Vessels.  they also began this morning to sprinkle our street -- everything looks like summer -- all nature seems beaming with life --
Teusday April 14th
It is a pretty day -- I am playing Nurse while my nurse is working  it is hard work as my boy weighs over thirty pounds -- I went down town to day -- children went in a hack to Mr Edwin? Hunt's party -- at nine O. clock.  Mr Badger and I went after them -- we enjoyed the little party and stayed untill 12 Oclock. I received the childrens Photographs this afternoon -- I had letters from my Sisters to day -- they all better --

Wednesday April 15th 1863.
This morning it rained but now it is clear.  we are all busy to day making preparations for the Sewing Society this afternoon.  they came at three -- and sewed untill Six.  there were twenty five sewing on fancy articles for a fair, that is to be for the Unitarian Church -- after tea we had a band of Music, and a large number of the Congregation young and old came in -- we had many young ladies and Gentlemen. we danced untill ten O.clock -- then we had supper for the crowd -- we had a nice time -- Ella stayed all night with us --
Thursday April 16th
It is a beautiful day -- Ella went home after breakfast -- Mrs Tuttle and Miss Emerson came to see me -- at five Mr Badger came for me to go and see Whites house on Wabash and Hubbard Court.  we returned home too late to go to Depot to see our relations off -- Mr & Mrs Hilton & Ella, gone to Louisville.
Friday April 17th
Again it is fine weather -- I wrote home -- and will go shopping to day -- went to the Office and Father Badger took me to see his portrait, Mr Honore took dinner with us -- children all well out playing.
Saturday April 18th
It is very fine to day -- we all well.  Eva gone to have her teeth straightened -- all of the children took their bath -- Mr Forbes the Artist came to see my children -- he heard they were so beautiful -- and to ask me to let him take their Portraits -- children are invited to a party at Mrs Wheelocks to night -- but it now rains so fast that they will send their regrets -- Mr Henry Honore came home to dinner with Mr Badger -- I have sore throat to night and fever --
Sunday April 19th
It rained early this morning -- but now is clear -- I went to Trinity Church alone -- after dinner I went to west end to Father Badgers -- with my Husband and four children  Walter and Tare? -- who dined with us  Mr Badger went to night Church --
Monday April 20th
It looked like rain this morning -- and did rain while I was out visiting -- I took Ada and Sheridan with me in the morning  called to see Mrs Lamb -- Mrs Clyde -- Mrs Thomas  Mrs G...? & Whetherbe also Mrs Sharp Mrs Perry -- Mrs Hunter -- Mrs G. P. Stone -- Mrs Howard and Mrs Gillet -- Mrs Cannon & Mrs Buchanan -- Mrs Carter Harrison  I met and took her with me -- she has the Grasshopper Club meet at her house thursday night.  I took Belle & Eva with me riding in afternoon -- children invited to morrow night to a little party at Dr Rutters -- Mrs Turnley,s little girl gives it -- after Tea Mr Bigelow came in and played a game of I?uchre with us.
Teusday April 21st
It rains this morning -- baby has cold -- but better this morning -- I think I will go out to day -- Mr Badger gives up this palace we now live in on the first of May -- we have taken Alex Whites house -- children all four went to Miss Turnleys party -- Mr Badger & I went after them -- they had a nice time

[Hannah?]] 28
Wednesday April 22nd 1863.
It looks like rain- received letters from home all better?. I went out with Ada of unclear to have more Photographs taken-after dinner I called to see Mrs Bobb & Mrs Geo Gray- returned home late
Thursday April 23rd 
It is a lovely day- Mrs. Goodridge called-also Mrs. Leclue-Misses Forsyth and Mrs Drake & Mrs Mix and Miss Sheldon after unclear we went with  Mrs. Bigelow t Mr. Caster Harrison to the Grasshopper Club had a nice time returned late.
Friday April 24th
Received letters from home-all better Brother uncleart will be home in a few days-a lovely day- I went shopping- Mister Fleetwood and Mrs McCabe heard of the unclear unclear death of Mr. Henry Clark-Mrs Jennie Stewart's brother in law. children gone to Mrs Walker's to tea- Mr & Mrs J.B. Walker came over and played unclear with us all unclear.
Saturday April 25th
It is pleasant weather, unclear all well. busy cleaning expecting to move unclear Mr Gaffin called to see me, I went to Mrs Peck's and spent a pleasant evening. Mr Badger went to a meeting of the bankers at Mr. unclear.
Sunday April 26th
beautiful day-I went to Mrs Thomas's church with Belle & Eva Mrs Bigelow. Albert Badger Brackett, Father Badger & Horace all dined with me- after dinner we all went to Father Badger's at unclear and Brother unclear came this morning- I went with Mrs Badger Belle & Eva to the Fremont Hotel to meet him and made him bring his trunk unclear to our house and stay with us-he was afraid to come for fear of giving our children scarlet fever-as his own have it.
Monday April 27th
All morning I have been packing- in the afternoon I went shopping- and at seven went down to the Depot to see friends off. Mrs Herfact? called to see us-
Tuesday April 28th
It has rained almost all day-I have kept myself busy packing toys for the children to move to our new house-after tea unclear David & myself played cards.I wrote home- us all well- Hannah returned this morning- Mr Badger myself and all children went to the Depot this morning to meet Sister Hilton Ella Mr Hilton & Mr Hunt but they did not come
Wednesday April 29th
This is a lovely day- I went out early and invited a large number of persons to our home Friday to meet the Grasshopper Club. We all well- I went to the Office and much to my surprise Mr Hunt was there-he arrived at night-after tea David unclear Mr Badger and the four children went to Negro Minstrels- I was one of the party-

Thursday April 30 1863 Another beautiful day. We all in health. Mrs Wheeler called and Henry Wheeler sent me his photograph, made a little tissue dress for Mattie Shreve. Mrs Bunch just called to say that Mr Smith wanted us to move tomorrow, but we cannot get our house until next week. Mr Hunt called after tea. Friday May 1st 1863 This is a very bright lovely morning. after breakfas Mr. Smith had a bedroom and parlour sett moved into our house and expected to move in himself, but we could not give up this house until we get possession of Mr White's , which we have rented and will go into house on friday. after seeing Mr Smith for his furniture, I sent downtown to do some shopping for David. returned at one o'clock and arrenged everything for you Grasshopper club, at nine they came and we had quite a crowd. enjoyed unclear very much. so did every one. had nice music and a good supper. I and my servants did not retire until 4 o'clock in the morning. I fixed a lunch for my Brotherinlaw Mr Faulds to take with him in the morning. Mr A.D. Hunt was one of my guests. Saturday May 2nd After breakfast I had the house nicely cleaned then Belle & Eva went out and invited about thirty children here. they came at seven, danced by the Pianao, and seemed to enjoy themselves. I gave them a nice little supper. They all went home at eleven. Corbin Ariana and Octava assisted me entertaining them. I went out walking with Mr Hunt in the afternoon. My brother Mr Faulds returned to Louisville at seven this morning. Sunday May 3rd More beautiful weather. I did not go to church. Only Mr Badger went after dinner. Mr Bigelow called for Mr Badger to take a drive with him. Mr Hunt called and spent the evening Monday May 4th Again I seat myself to add a few lines in my journal. It looked like rain all day. we all in health. children at school. I and servants have been very busy all day house cleaning. Mr Hunt and Guthrie called for my husband and they all went out to spend the evening with Mr Honore. I learned from home of the death of Mr Abraham Nite of Louisville and old and mch respected citizent - 63 years old. Tuesday May 5th It has rained all day and at times snowed.  We have been all day packing and cleaning. We are unclear through. unclear Hilton took tea with us and unclear Wednesday May 6th It rained last night and if sunny this morning. We all well. at half past nine Mr Badger and I went to Alexanders Whites Auction at the house we have taken, we stayed until two. Mr Badger bought a few carpets, he came home with jeadache and went to bed, did not to to office.

Thursday May 7th 1863
It has been a fine day -- we have everything packed.  will move to morrow.  Miss Whitehouse and the Brothers came to see me -- so did Fannie Patrick and Mrs Allport.  I received a letter from home, all well there.  at four Mr Badger myself and children all went over to Mrs Pieks? to see her furniture that she wants to sell -- as she is going to Pike,s Peak to live -- I went and made my regrets to Mrs Sharp that I could not attend the club at her house, Mr Hunt came in and spent evening with us  he gave me his Photograph, Mary Tyler Johnson with others has been sent to the line of Dixie -- for being Secesh -- there is now going on a fearful battle on the Rappanhanock.  so far the federals have been repulsed with great loss.  it was a mistake I learn about Mary Johnston -- it was not her --
Friday May 8 --
All morning busy getting everything ready to move at two, O. clock -- it is a lovely day -- the cart came and commenced moving our things  I shipped and my husband went to Mr Whites house that we have rented -- and received -- at six we stopped for the evening -- Mr Bigelow came and Mr Hunt to see us -- So did Henry Wheeler -- we all well --
Saturday May 9th 1863.
All hands engaged in moving things -- good Weather -- Mr Busch came in at three O. clock. and Mr Smith,s family moved in before we got out -- we left the house at five I felt much regret at parting with my old and beautiful residence, that we have spent so much time and so very pleasantly -- we arrived at our new destination at half past five -- found things very comfortable -- Mr Hunt came in to tea and we played Iuchre untill eleven. O. clock.
Sunday May 10th
It sprinkles to day -- Mr Badger gone to Sunday school.  I have not been out all -- we all well -- but not at all Settled --
Monday May 11th
Again the weather is good -- i went down town to get some carpets and furniture -- bought two Chamber Setts -- and four Carpets.  it rained and Mr Badger brought me home in a hack.  we have not made much headway in arranging house untill carpets are down --
Teusday May 12th
Mrs Haddock called to see me -- again I went down street to select articles for house use -- while at the Office Brother Hilton came in from Louisville -- Mr Hunt Mr Badger & myself all went to the Depot to see Mrs Hilton and Ella Badger.  they look well -- their Car smashed up -- but no one killed.  they were many hours behind time -- we stayed at home all evening.

May 17 new York
Hannah 16
Wednesday May 13th 1863.
This morning the sun shone brightly -- we are all in good health -- and ought to be grateful for our many blessings.  at 11 O. clock I took Sheridan with me, and went down in the street Cars to Mrs Pieks house on Michigan Avenue -- theshe? had an auction of all their furniture I bought some things -- then went to the Office met Sister Licinia there -- Mr Hunt took Mr Badger Mrs? Hilton & myself to Mrs Johnsons and we had Cream Cakes and Champagne -- we then went shopping -- after we got through Mr Hilton & wife came home with us and spent the evening untill eleven , O. clock -- Mr Bigelow also came in and we had a nice game of Iuchre -- Mr Hunt and Mr Frank Newcomb took cars for Louisville -- Mrs Hoyne came in to invite Mr Badger and I to the Grasshopper Club at her house --
Thursday May 14th 1863.
It is cool to day but beautiful -- we all well -- our furniture has come and we shall be very comfortable -- we go to night to Mrs Hoyne,s  Mr Bigelow goes with us.  Belle,s Music teacher came to day -- Mr Bulter of New York also went with us to the club -- we had a delightful evening -- returned home at two -- Mr Frank Honore gave me a boquet
Friday May 15th 1863
It is again very beautiful -- I employed myself all morning -- then went down town to do some shopping -- returned home late -- we all well --
Saturday May 16th
Eva went to the Dentist early -- but did not return, untill three O.clock. I was uneasy about her for fear something had happened to her -- I went down town, met Licinia & Alice -- stayed a little while and Mr Badger came home early -- and picked up all his clothes -- Hannah Keith left to night for a while?
Sunday May 17th
