I went with Belle & Eva to Mr Thomas,s church -- missed the car, and walked -- Mrs Flint brought me home in her Carriage.  Mr Badger went out to his Fathers, and brought Ariana, Licinia, Ella, his Father, and Hutchings and Horace in with him -- they all walked in -- he then packed his Valisse and myself and four children -- also Octave -- all went to the Depot with my husband to see him off, our coloured man took his valisse -- the number of our party was 16 -- Mr Badger went to New York.  Eva lost her blue silk bow.  we all well -- I wrote home --
Monday May 18th
Again a fair day -- we all well -- Mrs Cannon & Mrs Buchannan came to see me -- we still are busy finishing our house furnishing  after tea Mr Staar and Mr Whetherbe came in -- we had a nice game at Iuchre --
Teusday May 19th
Received a letter from my husband -- he arrived safe -- I went down town -- made some purchases -- Hannah came to say her Brother is dead

baby walk May 21st
Wednesday May 20th
Mrs Allport -- Miss Whitehouse & brothers? came to see me -- also Mrs Penton -- I went down street and bought baby a new Carriage some table linen door mats -- lace for Vestibule door -- Mr & Mrs Thomas spent evening with us  Licinia & children here,
Thursday May 21st
I rose early -- went to Mrs Hobsons  got her to make Mattie Faulds & Shreve new hats -- ordered some Photographs of Mattie Belle, and returned  home.  found Licinia Alice & Florence at our house to spend some days.  I went with our guests and my two children down town, me Mr Thomas & Mr Bigelow -- they walked with us, I took my party to Mrs Johnsons Ice cream Saloon.  Mr Bigelow took us all to see his house on Mich where he keeps bachelors hall.  we then walked home.  Mr Bigelow took tea with us, and spent the evening.  Young Mr Ward called.  Mrs Gurnee & Miss called and Mrs Hall -- baby commenced to day first time to walk round a chair)
Friday May 22nd
It is very warm and dusty -- Sister Licinia and I went down to Mrs Hobsons.  as we were going into the store a man passed calling fire -- and it proved to be Mrs Hobsons Milliner store at the back a Carpenter shop burned down and scorched her back buildings?.  she was much frightened  they played a great deal of water on Bryan Hall which injures it some.  finally the Unitarian Church on Washington street -- of which Mr Thomas is the pastor caught, and burned to the ground.  a perfect wreck. we stood and saw it burn for a few minutes when a Hose pipe burst -- throwing water all over us.  we returned home then. and dressed ourselves and at five went to the Office -- got Walter & Octave and went round to the Tremont Hotel to dine with Mr Bigelow, he treated us handsomely -- and we came home again at eight o. clock  I went right to bed feeling bad from cold --
Saturday May 23rd
We all well and bright this morning.  received a letter from Mr Badger he arrived safe in New. York.  it rained a little -- but fear it may continue at eleven.  Ariana Generette and her two boys -- with Ella Badger came in to spend the day -- also Dora Allen with children  at five all our whole party went with me to Mrs Johnsons cream Saloon and I treated them then Mrs Generette, Ella, and two boys went out in Madison cars for their home  Mr Bigelow came and played cards.  a horse nearly ran over us down street and the screen in fireplace fell on baby --
Sunday May 24th
We had a chapter of incidents and accidents yesterday -- to complete all this Morning Flags are floating through the City -- they say Vicksburgh is taken by the federals.  I went with Licinia Belle & Eva to Mr Ryders Universalist church -- which they have kindly lent to us for a time untill our New church is finished -- Mr Bigelow walked home with us -- so did Mr Thomas.  at four O. clock we all -- nine in Number -- went out to Father Badgers. Mr Hilton came from Louisville this morning -- returned home to tea.  left Licinia and children and brought Ella home with us.  Mr Bigelow and Octave went to night church with us.  Mr Thomas preached a Commemorative sermon on the old church.  it was good.

Hannah 26. -- 29
Monday May 25th 1863
I received a letter from Mr Badger -- he is well, also one from home.  Judge Maniere died on Saturday.  our black woman Nancy sick to day.  Ella & I went out shopping with Sheridan & Ada, did not return untill late -- was caught in the rain.  bought myself and children buff calicoes, silk gloves and a blue spotted Lawn for myself.  after Tea Frank Honore, came in and we played cards -- went with him to see Mrs? Gurnee, Ella stayed all night with me.
Teusday May 26th
It looks like rain -- baby had a severe fall out of his Crib -- on the top of his head.  and to finish the incidents of the day Ada tossed up a China doll. which came down on his head Hannah came back this morning.  I have a bad sorethroat.  Ella went home at four O. clock.  I wrote to Mr Badger and Virginia  I was so sick at six that I had to go to bed, and send for the doctor.  Eva has been for weeks having her front took tooth? straightened  Henry Wheeler came to see me --
Wednesday May 27th
This is a bad day -- I suffered all night with my throat.  Dr did not come -- Eva has bought a new ball. Mrs Dudley,s little girl fell into a well yesterday -- she was a beautiful two year old child her only daughter -- her husband was in New York at the time and she at the Tremont Hotel.  it was very sad -- received a letter from Mr Badger -- he at the St. Nicholas Hotel.  Mrs Flint & Lena came to see me -- also Mr Henning.
Thursday May 28th
It is a rainy day -- Dr Small came to see me -- and says I have congestion of the Tonsils.  baby got another bad fall -- on the back of his head.  but it dont seem to trouble him  I am in bed. Mr & Mrs Perry called --
Friday May 29th
It has been raining all day -- Dr. called and I am so much better he will not come again -- Hannah gone to day to Bridgeport  Ella & Ariana came to see me -- I am up and feel very well.  I sent a regret to Fred Tuttle for Belle and Eva -- to his party.  Vicksburgh not taken yet -- it is a fearful contest.  there has been great rejoicing.  cannon and rockets -- and flags flying in honor of its being taken by Federals.  but so far they have not succeeded -- received a letter from Pauline in Switzerland --
Saturday May 30th
It rained nearly all day -- children at home playing -- received from home a Leghorn Cap for Sheridan -- a present from Virginia -- children went out after dinner -- my throat not well yet -- I am not out of my room.  I received a letter from my husband -- all the children well -- Belle bought a ball--

Hannah 5th
Sunday May 31st 1863.
It has been a funny day -- raining, sun shining and hailing --- none of us went to church -- but Nurse Ellen.  Father Badger came to see me -- after tea Mr Beigelow called -- and Mr Henning -- I went down first time for a week.  I wrote seven letters.
Monday June 1st
To day has been ushered in with bright sunshine -- and wind high.  we all well. received a letter from Mr Badger -- he sent me a splendid large Honiton collar -- just come in -- it is so kind and thoughtful.  Mr Bigelow invited me to go to Mr Herfoots on Wednesday  our club meets there.  I took a carriage to go down town -- and took the four children with me -- went shopping.  after tea Miss Flint came in and spent the evening with us.
Teusday June 2nd 1863.
Again the Weather is fine.  I rose at five -- expect to meet Mr Badger down. scratched out Mr Busch at his house to buy some of his linen -- our relations from New York will be here at seven this afternoon.  we are all in fine health  at nine I went to Mr Busch,s with Ada -- met him, and bought about 100 a hundred dollars worth of his linen -- then went shopping -- Mr Feild of New York came and brought two very pretty black & white check Parasols for children -- that their Father sent them.
Wednesday June 3rd 1863.
It is a beautiful day -- we all well -- at 7 O. clock. Octave & Brackett went to the Depot and brought home with them -- Uncle James Badger  Aunt Harriet & their Daughter Hattie from New York -- to make us a visit  after breakfast we went down town and brought home to dinner with us -- Mother Badger Licinia & Ella -- Ada fell and hurt her cheek right badly -- Mr Feild called to see me this Afternoon after Tea Miss Fleetwood & Mr Morde called to see me -- also Mr Fisher -- Albert.  Father Badger and mother came to tea.  we played cards untill late -- Mr Badger sent two black and white check Parasols to Belle & Eva -- there is a great excitement in town on account of Burnsides ordering the Times Office to be closed -- and not to publish any more --
Thursday June 4th
It is very fine Weather.  we all well -- after dinner Aunt Harriet & I went to a lecture given by Mr Wheeler on the Human Organism -- I enjoyed it much -- afterwards we went down town -- after tea Mr Bigelow came in -- Mr Feild & Miss Flint -- Bracket also -- we had a pleasant evening  I sent off Virginia,s and Matti,s hats to Louisville   Mrs Robb and Miss Craig called --
Friday June 5th
Beautiful morning -- Aunt Harriet & I going out -- we all take tea with Father Badger to night.  Hannah came this morning -- Mrs Long called to day -- it is now quite cool --

Pa June 6th 1863.
butter 9
Saturday June 6th 1863.
It is a pretty bright morning -- we are all in health.  we stayed at Father Badgers last night untill twelve O. clock -- all came home in an Omnibus.  had a pleasant evening -- at six O. clock Mr Feild came to tea -- also Walter & Brackett -- after tea we all went to the Theatre  quite a large party -- returned home at eleven  found my Father had arrived from Louisville.  we have cream Champagne & cakes.
Sunday June 7th 1863.
Went to Trinity Church with Mrs James Badger & my Father -- in going down my front stairs -- I slipped and strained both ankles -- and in trying to save myself I sprained both wrists.  but did not feel hurt  after dinner went out to West End with all our party.
Monday June 8th 1863
Rose early.  Aunt Harriet and Uncle James Badger left at eight -- for Milwauk[[i?]e -- they design a tour through the west.  she left her daughter Hattie with me untill she returns -- she is fourteen years old -- my ankles hurt me so much to day, that I have bound them in went Arnica cloths.  Mr Willard called after tea --
Teusday June 8th
Our Weather is fine -- all in health but me -- I am here with my ankles.  Mr Feild called at four to say Good bye -- I went down to see him -- our butter came to day -- my new chip hat has come -- I am sick in bed with sprained ankles, and Rheumatism.  Mr Bigelow called to night to say Good bye -- he leaves for New York.
Wednesday June 10th
Fine Weather.  all well but me -- I am still troubled with Rheumatism sent for Dr Small.  he thinks I will soon be well -- Mr ? Vandervoght called also Miss Byford.  Hattie gone to Barbers to have her hair curled for the club at Mr Herfoot,s to night -- my children will not go.  heard from Mr Badger.  I will write him to day.  Hattie did not go. it looked like rain.
Thursday June 11th
Another fine day -- I still in bed -- with inflamatory Rheumatism  Mrs & Miss Rogers called -- Miss Ward Mrs D. Goodwin & Mrs Ely.  Mr A. D. Hunt called to see me from Louisville.
Friday June 12th
Again fine Weather -- I still in bed with my Rheumatic fever. Ella Badger came in to spend some days -- received a letter from Mr Badger with Jamie Stanwoods picture in it  Mr Hunt called --
Saturday June 13th
A beautiful day -- Ella. Hattie. Belle. & Eva gone to spend the day with Father Badger.  they returned late.  Mr Hunt called -- also Licinia  she came to tell me she had been with Mr Hilton, to see the house he had bought on Wabash near the corner of Jackson.  a very handsome stone house -- four stories high  cost fourteen thousand -- they have also bought some of the furniture.

June 17 White came
linen 21st
Sunday June 14th 1863.
Still in bed stiff with Rheumatism.  all the boys here to dinner.  fine Weather.  Father Badger came to dinner.  little children are complaining a little.  Pa still with me
Monday June 15th
Ella here to day and Licinia.  Mr Hunt also took dinner -- received a letter from home.
Teusday June 16th
To night we have the Opera -- Octave, Licinia, Hattie, Brackett, and Mr Hilton all went.  received a letter from Mr Badger
Wednesday June 17th
Our Weather is warm and dry -- Hattie went down and had her hair cut off.  Sheridan also went to the Barbers and had his hair cut  Licinia John & Mr Hunt came here to tea  Mrs Larna?m & Alex?  Ila? called.
Thursday June 18th
Fine Weather -- all well -- I feel better -- got up and dressed  Mrs Wm Johnson called also Miss Steele  Belle has two little girls  taken tea with her  after ten Miss Matilda Clark called --  Mr White has been here having trees fixed
Friday June 18th
Fine Weather -- all well but me -- I spend bad night -- but still am better -- I am fixing childrens leghorn hats --
Saturday June 19th 1863
This morning at eight O. clock. Mr Badger arrived from New York with a number of beautiful presents for us all -- he brought me a real lace shawl. two handsome robe? Lawns. one Pena dress -- two combs -- one steel and one gold.  also two gilt bands for the hair -- a steel buckle with leather wrought in it.  a lot of buttons (pearl) and ruffling.  Albums for children and parlour skates a handsome travelling basket.  beside numerous other things -- he looks well.  Ella here -- Licinia came in also -- Ella went to the Opera -- Mr Hunt came to see mr Badger.
Sunday June 20th
All well -- but me -- I am much better  all the boys here to day -- Mr Hunt took dinner with us.  I had Mr Hunt come up stairs and see me -- Mr Badger and Pa went to night church.  Mr Hunt left to night for Louisville.
Monday June 21st
I am much better to day -- all well -- Ella & Hattie went out to the farm this afternoon -- Belle gone to see Ella Walker -- they have commenced paving our street to day --dirt is being thrown on  Mr Badger gone out to his Fathers -- my bill came in from Mr Busch for linen.  it was one hundred & fifty dollars.  great excitement in Washington  the rebels marching on to Baltimore -- they are very strong  it is believed that Vicksburgh will fall --- she is so surrounded by Federals.

Tuesday June 22nd 1863
Another bright day -  all in health -  I think I am getting better.  Hattie gone to spend the day with Miss Hutchingson,  Mrs. Gage and   Miss Whetherbe came to see me.  also Mrs. Truman & Mrs B. F. Sherman
Wednesday June 23rd
Our weather getting warm.  my dress maker came up to fit me.  Nancy sick with Pleurisy - sent for Dr Bartlett for me and Nancy   he thinks he can cure my Rheumatism.  Ellen here.
Thursday June 24
At five O.clock this afternoon Aunt Harriett and Uncle James arrived from St Louis.  they well - we all glad to see them   Licinia & Ella here - Walter, Albert, Breckett & Millie Haskill came in after tea - and we all had a nice time.
Friday June 25th
Fine Weather - received a letter from home.  Ma not well -  Aunt Harriet went visiting with Brackett  Mr. Badger Uncle James.  Ada & Sheridan all went out to west end.
Saturday June 26
Very warm morning.   our friends remained at home until four O.clock, then all went out to West End  -  my children also and my Father -  I went to bed early.
Sunday June 27th
A beautiful day - but warm.  Mr. Badger went to Sunday school.  all the rest remained at home -  the boys as usual came in to dinner.   at seven O.clock Uncle James and family all left for New York.   all my family went to the Depot with them.   at ten O.clock we had a shower of rain.
Monday June 28th
It looks like rain to day.   at five O.clock we had a severe? rain - which pleased all.  I am much better - have been busy all day cutting out work for my seamstress.
Tuesday June 29th
We all feel pleased that the childrens school end to day -  they have worked hard and well.  Belle's report had one hundred for every thing which is the highest mark given.  Eva had a great many marks of one hundred but a few not reaching that.    had a letter from home.  all well but Ma    she is complaining a great deal.
no entry for June 30
Wednesday July 1st 1863
It is very warm weather -  all well.  I am much improved - almost well.  Dr Bartlett came to see me.  he took tea with us.  Mr Badger invited to a party at Burley's.  I and all the children are invited to a Picnic at Mr Herfoots.
Thursday July 2nd
This is another warm day.  all well.  children went out early to buy flowers to give Mrs Grover to deck the school room with, for the examination at three O.clock.  Mrs Tileston and Grace arrived in city and came right up to see us -  from Boston.  they have been to St Louis to see her brother married.  I was delighted to see them.  they leave to night   Belle & Eva have gone to the exhibition dressed in swiss and blue ribbons - they look well.

Friday July 3rd 1863
I had a call today from Mrs Ludington, Miss Messinger  Misses Hill. Miss Bowlin.  Mr Thomas Miss Flint came in and spent the evening - also Mr Whetherbe  Mr Badger took a Carriage and invited Mr & Mrs Tileston & Grace to drive - they went out to Father Badgers and then came again to see me.  we had Ice cream & Cake.  I went town in the parlor first time for weeks -  George Gerish is here from New York. to make this his home.
Saturday July 4th
We have a warm day - there is much noise all around us from fireworks and Crackers.   we all at home.   at four 0.clock Mr Badger Bell& Eva went to his Fathers.  I wrote home today.  Mr Badger brought me a very large lot of fine linen for table - Pa took Ada & Sheridan to see the fireworks after tea.  Mr Badger and children did not return until 12 O clock.
Sunday July 5th
It is very warm this morning.  Nancy our coloured woman came up to see us beore we got out of bed.  to say that her Husband she was afraid was killed as he had gove to Bridgeport with a party that was brought home injured from a fight they had got into.  we have not found out anything yet.  Father Badger Mr Hilton, Walter  Millie Haskill all took dinner with us    after dinner Mr Hilton & Mr Badger took a buggy and drove to Bridgeport to find out something of Jim.   while they were there a man brought Jim home - very much bruised in the face & hands   he attempted to run out of the house, and was surrounded by a gang of drunken irish who beat him and left him in the road.  he was taken into a neighbors and cared for -  he is now in bed - all three of them were beat? at five   Aunt Lizzie & Mother Badger came in to see me - and spent the evening
Monday July 6th 1863
This is a warm day -  we all well -   Hannah did not come.  I wrote home  - great excitement in the City.  Bonfires & fireworks.  Cannon and bells ringing   Vicksburgh taken by Grant.
Tuesday July 7
Hannah came this morning.  all of us in health.   after dinner Pa took Belle & Eva to ride, they came home late.  Our new furniture arrived at five O.clock.  Mr Badger assisted unpacking it.  Pa Belle Eva Ada Sheridan & myself all went to the Menagerie of Van Amburgh.  Ella Walker and Gussie Stone took tea with children
Wednesday July 8th
Again warm weather.  all well.   baby getting his eye teeth.  they annoy him some.  Mrs & Miss Gurnee called to say good Bye -  Pa took children and treated them to ice cream.
Thursday July 9th
Ella came in at eight this morning to go with Octave to a Picnic but looked so much like rain, they gave it up -  Ella returned home at four.  Mr Bigelow called to night - he just returned from Boston.  Looks well   Mr Gerish also came in - we had a pleasant evening.

[written at top of page  Eva Music July 16]
Friday July 10th 1863
All well but Sheridan & Ada -  they complaining this morning - received a dispatch from David ordering home immediately his young man Perry.  I received from Louisville the childrens swiss tucked dresses and blue berege? ones.  I had them made there.  children invited to night to take tea with Lily Harmon.
Saturday July 11th 1863.
It has turned very cold, and looks like rain.   we are all well.   but Nancy the cook.  she has Dr Bartlett attending her.  Mr Perry took tea with us.  children gone down town.
Sunday July 12th
Again it looks like rain or snow.  it is quite cold.   we are all in health.  Mr Badger gone to Sunday school and church.  Pa out walking.  I will write home.  the Ransom family are here for a few days.  Louisville again in danger.  they are fortifying the city.  Father Badger was here Florence, Hutchings, Brackett Wm Haskill & Mr Gerish.  also Mr Schaffer of New York.   after dinner Mr Badger went out to his Fathers.
Monday July 13.th
I cut out to day the childrens blue berege? dresses -  at one O.clock Miss Mary Bowson of Louisville with Mr Woolfe called to see me -  also Licinia came in - at two my Father proposed our going to the Circus to see the Hippopotamus.  we agreed and went   my Father Licinia Hilton.  Belle Eva Ada Sheridan Baby & Nurse Ellen and myself - we were pleased -  the animal is horribly ugly.  Licinia came home with us to tea - Mrs Burton & Miss Burton called to see me.   after ten Mr James Miller called to see me.
Friday July 14th
To day has been warmer.  we all in health.  the children went down street this afternoon.  Pa has gone to the Theatre to night.  Mr Badger is at home.
Wednesday July 15th 1863
Again a fine day.  I went down street with Ada to day first time for several weeks.  went to Mrs Herveys and bought Sheridan a pretty suit of mode coloured Marsailles braid with black.  also went to my dress makers.  My Father intended to leave to night but concluded to remain until to morrow.  after ten he and I went to the Theatre to see Mr Warren.  Mr Badger and children went out to the west end to see his father.
Thursday July 16th
To day is very fine -  I after dinner got all the children ready and Pa and I went out to Cottage Grove for a ride   Mrs Rogers & daughter called to see me, also Miss Rice.   at seven O.clock my Father left for Louisville and Octave went to New York.  in the morning at eight O.clock all of us went to the Depot to see Mother Badger & Aunt Lizzie  also Horace to to Rock Island.   Mr Bigelow spent the evening with us.  Eva commenced? music from Miss De Pelgrin

Friday July 17th 1863
We have had bad news to day from home - Mattie Faulds has Fluse?  and very sick.  I went down street and spent some time    bought Sheridan a drab Marsailles suit Braided with black.  Belle & Eva went to the dress makers to be fit for swiss waists first time in their lives.   there has been a fearful Mob in New York.  much loss of property and life.
Saturday July 18th
It is getting a little warmer.   children gone to Mr Walkers to tea   I went down street with Mr Thomas.   he returned with me and stayed to tea.  Mrs Beecher called to see me.  Walter came to see us   Mattie grown worse.  very feeble.
Sunday July 19th
It looks like rain to day.  I did not go to church.  Mr Badger gone to Sunday School.  no news from home to day.  I was very anxious to go to Louisville to night - but my Husband thinks I had better wait for a dispatch.  I am very uneasy about Mattie - she is my little neice [sic] but with spine disease .  and very delicate.
Monday July 20th
It is cool and pleasant    a dispatch came to day saying Mattie was better, so I will not go.   we are all well.   Morgan the rebel has been defeated in Indiana -  many of his men taken but he and many of his men escaped
Tuesday July 21st
Mrs & Miss Van Arnans came to see me.  I went down town after dinner   it rained a little.  I went with all the children to see Licinia.  I stayed all evening   she better
It is a beautiful day -  after breakfast I took the four children and went to Father Badgers at West End.   spent the whole day   found Licinia sick.  She preparing to move.
Wednesday July 22nd
I went down town to day.   Had Sheridan a buff suit stamped?   went to Mr Hiltons.  he took me all over his house.   it is quite handsome.   Mrs Parsons called to see me - also Miss Tucker   letter from home say all better.  I went with all the children to see Mrs Duffield.
Thursday July 23rd
I went out a little while this morning.   Mrs Sharp called to see me.  Lidy? Duffield spent the day with us.  Mr Thomas & Mr Fisher spent the evening with us.  Licinia moved in to day.
Friday July 24th
It looks like rain  -   we need it much.  everything is suffering for it.  I went down to see Licinia.  she still quite unwell.  I then went down town shopping.   it rained -  after tea Mr Badger myself and three children all went to the Theatre to see Warren - all our relations were there.
Saturday July 25th
Mrs & Miss Van Arnans came to see me.   I went down town after dinner   it rained a little.   I went with all the children to see Licinia.  I stayed all evening  -  she better.

Sunday July 26th 1863.
It is a lovely day.  we are all well.  thank our Heavenly Father    Miss Adele Flint called to take me to church with her.   we went to Bishop Whitehouse's on the west side -  children went with their Father to Mr Thomas's.  Mr Bigelow dined with us.  also Brackett, Albert, Walter & Millie Heiskell  Mr Badger at home for a wonder.   on Sunday Afternoon.  Father Badger here also.  I wrote to my Brother Joe.
Monday July 27th
This is a pretty day.  I went down town with Alice and bought some goods for Licinia - returned home late with headache   Alice & Florence here -
on Tuesday 28 I went calling - went to see Mrs Cannon.  Mrs Smait.  Miss Nowlin   at ten O.clock our bell rang, and much to the surprise of all my sister Mrs Faulds husband  Mattie & James all arrived at our house 0 we were delighted.  Mattie looks very badly.
Wednesday July 29th
At seven this morning David left our house for New York.  all seem tired after their journey here.  I went down street a little.  stopped in to see Licinia - she getting better
Thursday July 30th
This is my reception day - we all well -  Mattie getting better.  Mrs Clark and Miss Matilda called to see me - I have had a headache to day - Mr Bigelow called to see us.
Friday July 31st
This is my Husbands birthday - we all very well -  I went visiting - called to see Mrs Trabue  Mrs Ely - Mrs Robb - Mrs Chittendam - Mrs Mc Vicker.  Mrs Flint. Mrs Brown. Mrs. Pitney   then came home  took all the children - went to the Office for Mr Badger and we all went out to call on Mrs Heiskell at Father Badgers.  returned home late.
Saturday Aug 1st
It is very warm to day -  we are all suffering with the heat    at four Sister Virginia & children went out riding -  at six Mr Badger myself and all the children went out to Father Badgers to a Pic.Nic.  we returned at eleven O. clock.
Sunday Aug 2nd
It is again intensely warm.  Mr Badger gone to Sunday school   I went to Grace Church to hear Mr Locke preach -  I enjoyed his sermon.   after church took a ride with friends who brought me home.   went to see Licinia a few moments.  Mr Thomas here to dinner - he is Mr Badger's minister.   at four it rained severely - which cooled the air.  Father Badger and Mr Heiskell called

[Written above header   Belle sick Aug 5th 1863.  X.]
Monday Aug 3rd 1863.
It is beautiful to day -- the air is cool -- at twelve O. clock. I sent for a Hack. and the three children of my coloured woman Matilda went visiting.  Ella called -- Virginia went riding in an open carriage.
Teusday Aug 4th
After breakfast I went down street.  Mr Hunt came to see me.  we all quite well.  it grows very warm.  Sister gone riding.
Wednesday Aug 5th
I ordered a Carriage.  and took my two boys with me. and went out to the west end to Father Badgers and brought Mr & Mrs Heiskell in to dinner.  after dinner she and I called to see Licinia -- at six I ordered an open Carriage and took Mr & Mrs Heiskell and their son William to drive.  Bishop Duggan called to see us.  Mr A. Bigelow called and brought his brother with him.  Father Badger and Ella here.
Thursday Aug 6th
I went to Trinity Church and took my three girls with me.  Mrs Parsons called -- Mr Badger gone to dine with Mr Hunt  Walter came to see us.  after tea Mr Hilton & Licinia came in and spent evening with us.  Mr Badger went with Walter and Rev Thomas on top of new Unitarian Church. Mr & Mrs Heiskell went to Rock. Island, 
Friday Aug 7th
Mrs S. S. Hayes called -- it rained very fast this morning  after dinner I went with Sheridan to the Tremont Hotel to see Mr Hunt -- who leaves for Louisville to night.  Rev Thomas and Willie Heiskell spent the evening with us.
Saturday Aug 8th
It is very hot weather.  we suffer from heat -- all the children have gone to take their bath.  after dinner Belle. Eva. Ada and Sheridan went down street -- after tea we had a severe rain.  with Lightning and thunder.
Sunday Aug 9th
It is again very warm.  but I went heat and sun to church with Mr Badger and the four children to Mr Ryders church to hear Rev Hill.  Mr Bigelow dined with us -- also Father Badger Eddie Cutts and Albert.  at four O. clock. it poured rain and cooled the air a little.  Received letters from home.  William Heiskell & Eddie took tea with us.
Monday Aug 10th
It is again very warm -- we all in health.  Hannah did not come.  at four O. clock it poured rain.
Teusday Aug 11th
It is cool and pleasant this morning.  Louisa came to see us.  Hannah not come.  Mrs Flint called to write us to her house to morrow.  Willie Heiskell spent evening with us.

[Written at top of page   Sarah's baby - 19- musquitoes  Aug 19]
Wednesday Aug 12th 1863
This has been a very lovely day.  Ada quite unwell with fever and headache.  I went riding with all the children. and took the Duffields with us. who were spending the evening with us.   then returned and went with Virginia and children to see Mrs Hilton.  returned late.   Mr Badger gone to Mrs Flints party.  I did not go.
Thursday Aug 13th
A bright day - all of us well.  Ada much better.   no news   Mrs Ely called with Mrs Harris.
Friday Aug 14th
It is a bright day.  we all went out riding - it rained in afternoon   children had a fair.  Misses Bigelow were here and Hiltons children.
Saturday Aug 15th
Again it is very warm.  and looks like rain.  Mrs James Miller called.   at five O.clock my sister Virginia and our family all wenet to drive - we visited the toy shops - and Stister presented my children white porcelain vases. a top and doll.   and my husband a china cup & Saucer    Millie Heiskell here to night
Sunday Aug 16th
It is very warm to day - we all well but Ada -  she has very bad headache.  Brother David Faulds arrived this morning at eight - he and I went to Grace church   Mr Badger to Mr Thomas church.  Licinia and children came to say good Bye to Sister -  at eight O.clock my brother and his family all left us.   they returned home on the cars   we miss them very much.  Ada still has the headache.
Monday Aug 17th
It lightened [sic] fearfully last night and rained - and this morning is cooler.  Ada feels very well to day.  I went down street shopping   returned late.  Licinia and I went out to Father Badgers and late our husbands came -  Matilda left us to day.  she sick.
Tuesday Aug 18th
It is cool and delightful to day -  we all well.  busy house cleaning.  I am going out with children.  Mrs Dootie & Miss Flint called at four   I went with children and Licinia to see Ariana Generett.  returned late.
Wednesday Aug 19th
It is warm this morning.  we all well.   I will write home.  I intend to hire a man for our dining room.   we will be compelled to put up Musquitos bars to day.   they annoyed us last night.  Sisters black girl Sarah had a baby to day in Louisville.
Thursday Aug 20th
It is very fair to day.  Mr & Mrs James Trabue came to see me at four O.clock.  Mr & Mrs Haskell Ellen and all the Badgers.  also the Hiltons spent the evening with   we had a delightful evening.

[at top of page    Hannah 24    Octave Aug 25   Henry Friday 21st
Friday Aug 21st 1863.
It is quite warm this morning. I went down street and did some shopping- bought me a calico dress and magenta plaid dresses for the children. met Mrs. A. Bigelow at my husbands office. he invited Mr Badger  Mr Hilton & myself to go to Mrs Johnsons and get cream - we accepted,   after tea Mr Badger and I called upon Mrs Flints family. Mrs Bigelow called to see us.   we hired a black man this morning named Henry.
Saturday Aug 22nd
It is a bright day. I stayed at home to day cutting out work.   after dinner Mr Badger myself and four children went to Sister Hiltons to supper - had a nice time. Saw Capt Hite in the Office
Sunday Aug 23rd
It poured rain last night and looks like rain now. I went with Adele Flint to Trinity Church. Sheridan went with his father to Unitarian Church.   after dinner took all the children and went out to the West End to say good bye to Mr & Mrs Haskell  - who return to Boston in the morning.   baby sick to night    it turned very cool in the night.
Monday Aug 24th
Hannah came this morning. I went to the Office - saw Mr Barrett & his son Hite -  who returns to Kentucky to night    met Arianna Generett went with her to Licinias and took dinner - Major Wilson called to see me - so did Mrs Honores children    received a letter from Woodville Missippi [sic] - the first for two years from Uncle Stanwood        he has his third child a boy -  the war prevented our corresponding - after tea Mr & Mrs Wm H. Brown called    also Walter Hilton
Teusday Aug 25th
It is quite cool and delightful to day - after we went to breakfast Octavius Badger arrived from New York - quite well   I went with Licinia  Ada & Sheridan down street shopping    returned late - after tea I went with Mr Badger Octave and children to Licinias to play euchre. we had refreshments. Octave took us all to Mrs Johnsons and treated us to cream at two O.clock.     received a letter from Pa who is now in Cincinnati, and will go to New York. Sister Belle had a daughter at half past four this morning.   fourth baby.
Wednesday Aug 26
It is warmer to day - we all well - several girls have called to get me to hire them - I have not yet decided on one - Mrs Harlin & Mrs Davis called to see me - I went down street and then called to see Mrs Billings and Mrs Sherman about a girl     after tea Mr Badger Octave & myself all went to see Mrs Bronson

[At top of page]   Mary Sept 1st    Shreve baby Tuesday Aug 25 born -
Thursday Aug 27th 1863.
It is cold to day and looks like rain - last night Mrs Ludington had a party.  Octave went.  Miss D. Pelgram is giving Belle & Eva music lessons.
Friday Aug 28th
It is a pretty day.  I cut out work for my seamstress all morning - Miss Sherman called to see me about her girl May Ward - who I think of taking    I went out after dinner     after tea Mr Badger Octave Belle Eva Ada & myself all went to the Theatre to see Couldock play Dot.   we were very much pleased
Saturday Aug 29th
We are all in health this morning -  it is quite cold -  have had a fire made -  children invited to Mrs Willards to dinner   they went.   they also invited to a party at Mrs F. G. Adams on Monday.   at three I went down street.   then to the Office   went with Father Badger, Ada & Sheridan to Rock Island Depot to see Mother Badger Aunt Lizzie & Horace -  they came -  we all went out to the West End with them and took tea - returned late -  My Father gone to New York      Charleston South Carolina - my birth place is in danger   fort Sumpter is [captured - crossed out] taken and Wagner nearly gone -
Sunday Aug 30th
It is a beautiful day -  I went with my husband to Rev. Thomas church.  William Heiskell took dinner with  us.   after dinner Mr Badger Belle Eva and William all went out to Father Badgers   I wrote to Mary Tyler Johnson. Virginia Sis, Pa & Rev Heywood.  Mr G. Bigelow & William Heiskell here to night
Monday Aug 31st
This is again a fine day.  We all in fine health.  My sister Mrs T T Shreve had on Tuesday at half past four in the morning a fine daughter eleven pounds.  this is her fourth child   two girls and two boys.  Pa gone to New York.  I went down street wwith Eva & Sheridan after dinner   went out again and sent to Louisville many presents.   Ada went to Mrs P. G. Adams child party.   after tea I played billards [sic] with Mr Bigelow Mr Hilton  Octave - William Heiskell & Walter Hilton    our billard table was put on Saturday -
Tuesday Sept 1st
I sent my regret to Mrs Cobbs party to night   was down street most of the day - my new serving girl came to night   her name is Mary    -     after tea went to see Licinia
Wednesday Sept 2nd
It is cold & blustering.  I went out after dinner   called on Mrs Bronson.  Licinia here to night & family   Mrs Beckers party to night

[written above header at top of page]   Mr Badger New York Sept 8
Thursday Sept 3rd
This is my reception day.  I have headache.  Mrs Goodridge called also Mrs G. Hall.  Mrs E.G. Hall.   I refused all.  Licinia came to see me - after ten Mr Badger played billiards
Friday Sept 4th
I went out a little to day - we all well - received letters from home.   at two O.clock I took all my children, and Brother Hilton wife & four children all went with us to the Circus to see the trained Monkeys and dogs.  Mr A Bigelow came to see us.
Saturday Sept 5th
All day the wind has been high.   at four O.clock a fire commenced on State Street back of our house - it swept a long distance condemning many houses - then crossed the street and burned to the ground many on the opposite side - then the flames shifted over our stable and I then sent to the Office for my husband who came right up.   but our stable by that time was in flames - the firemen worked nobly and very soon subdued it - and we escaped without any other damage than the loss of stable and much dirt.   my friends were very alarmed and rushed in and begged me to pack up.   but I was not much frightened - and did very little -   my children were very much alarmed and cry very much -  Miss Casher rushed in and insisted upon my letting her pack up everything.  Mr James Miller and Rev Foney were very active - and did all they could    Mrs Bronson carried off the chldren to her house.   all was confusion -  many have suffered and lost all they had - most of the houses were frame and burned like tinder -  we allowed one family to put their things in our basement and gave them supper -  all the firemen Mr Badger treated to whiskey.   after ten Father Badger Mother Badger Aunt Lizzie & Ella came to see us.
Sunday Sept 6 1863
I went to church this morning with Ella Badger - Eva has the croup.  all the rest well.   Mr Badger gone to his Fathers   Wm Heiskell with him   I wrote home.
Monday Sept 7th
I went down street this morning.  with Belle & Sheridan - they went to see Mrs Bronson.   She gave Sheridan toys.  I returned home late.
Teusday Sept 8th
I cut out work all morning  Mr Badger came home early as he leaves for New York to night.  Ella Badger goes with him.  I went to Depot with him - and saw them off --

[top of page above header] 
Sept 13.
Henry $3-00
May Sept 14 -
Hannah Sept 10
Sept 13 Belle
Wednesday Sept 9th 1863
This is a fine day -- Eva better. Sheridan & I went down street shopping    bought children red cloth cloaks -- and new blue merino,s -- I went to see Licinia after tea -- saw seven children to day dressed up in old clothes of my children which I gave her.
Thursday Sept 10th
It rains often to day.  I went to my dress makers Mrs Carpenter to be fit to day -- I gave her my cloth dress and my black silk to make.  before returning home I went to the Tremont Hotel to see Mrs. S. S. Hamilton  there I met Ellen Geoghegan of Lexington -- she is up here to see her brother Sam who is at Camp Douglass a prisoner.  Hannah came to day--
Friday Sept 11th
To day looks like rain.  Mrs Keen & Mrs Davol?David? called to see me -- so did Ellen Geoghegan -- I packed some trunks to day.  after tea I went to Tremont Hotel to see Mrs Hamilton.    but she had gone -  Ellen gone to a party -- it now pours rain -- it is one O. clock.  my three children all have croup.  I wrote to Virginia to night
Saturday Sept 12.
It looks like rain -- all five of my children have cold with croup.  Licinia came to see me -- my cloth dress came home -- I went down street shopping.  Albert came home with me -- John Hilton here to tea--
Sunday Sept 13
It is a lovely day -- I went to church and found it very warm    took a walk after church on the Lake shore -- my baby has had all day croup.  all the rest better.  Belle & Eva went out to the west End with William.  I received a letter from Mr Badge   he at Pittsburgh -- will leave for New York.  when he wrote.  Belle not well to night.  Ada lost her first tooth to day -- Octave pulled it out -- lower tooth.
Monday Sept 14
It is beautiful to day -- quite warm.  we all better of colds    I went down street.    called on Ellen Geoghegan -- she and I went walking & shopping.  I returned home late.  My Milliner Mrs Hobson has arrived.  after tea Mr Fisher Mr Bigelow Mr Hoswell -- Melville  Willie Heiskell all came in also Eddie Cutts -- we played ten Pins.  Mary left us this afternoon -- did not like Sewing
Teusday Sept 15.
It is again warm -- Mother Badger & Ariana came in and took dinner with me -- I went out with Eva to buy children stockings.  I received a letter from David.  I have a bad cold to night.  Melly Ewing married.  butter here to night.

[At top of page above header\    Left home on Sept 19 -- with children
Wednesday Sept 16th 1863
It has been intensely hot to day.  I did not go out.  made childrens red cloth cloaks.  all my children went down to Ice Cream Saloon and treated themselves.  after ten Father Badger came in -- also Walter. and Mr Bigelow.  we played billiards -- received a letter from Pa in New York.  Dr & Mrs Pitney called -- I sent my regret to Mrs Ludingtons party.  we all better of our colds.
Thursday Sept 17
This is a busy day -- we all well -- hurrying to get off to Louisville just as busy we are as bees -- I spent most of the day down town shopping for presents.  it raining most of the day --
Friday Sept 18
I packed all my trunks to day -- Mother Badger Aunt Lizzie and Ariana came and stayed all day with me -- Licinia also came and said Good bye -- everything ready -- we will leave in the morning.
Saturday Sept 19
I arose at six.  had all the children dressed -- took our breakfast and left the house at seven in a hack -- got in the car -- and there was Walter Hilton Alice & Florence all to say good bye to us.  Mr Bigelow also came down.  at half past seven we started.  traveled along very safely and comfortably.  at five O. clock we stopped at Indianapolis -- went into the sitting and remained an hour.  met Capt Hinckley who was very kind and assisted us. with our packages.  we took the sleeping Car and met Mr Tom Martin & his daughter Annie going to Louisville    we all went to bed and slept untill two O. clock, then the Conductor woke us up -- and we got ready to leave -- as soon as the car stopped brother Faulds jumped in -- and took us all into the Omnibus -- we crossed the river and in a little while stopped at My Mothers door -- she and my Sister Virginia stood there to receive us.  they were all delighted to see us -- we had supper and got into bed at four O. clock.
Sunday Sept 20th
This is a lovely warm day -- we all well -- went to church with children -- heard Mr Cruik preach -- saw many friends  after church went down to Brother Shreve,s saw them all. Sister Belle looks pale and thin -- she has a beautiful little girl 4 weeks old.  her other two children are fine and hearty.  returned to Ma,s to dinner -- after dinner went to see Sister Belle again --
Monday Sept 21st
The Weather is warm and fine  I went down to see Liss -- then called to see Mrs Worley at Galt House.  Sally Hunt Mrs Harrison and Mrs Breckinridge called -- so did Miss Jane --

[Written above header]    Music Mr Gunter Sept 26
Teusday Sept 22nd 1863.
It is warm to day -- Sarah,s baby boy died suddenly this morning of spasms.  it five weeks old.  was buried well.  I went to see Siss.  after dinner we all took a ride and went to see Siss  Dr we dined with her -- there is a Government band plays lovely airs on Siss,s corner.  Dr Rogers called to see me. also Mrs Jane
Wednesday Sept 23rd
More beautiful weather.  we all well -- Sarah,s baby was buried to day -- I went to see Siss Mrs Edmonds and Miss Finley called to see me -- at four we went to drive  called to see Siss
Thursday  Sept 24th
This has been a beautiful warm day -- my children all out walking.  Virginia and I went riding called to see Siss.  at nine O. clock David ordered his Carriage and he and I went to Col Looneys party -- given to her Neice Mrs Gen Boyle just married.  I met many familliar faces -- ladies all dressed beautifully and looked very handsome.  Supper very nice -- returned at twelve.
Friday Sept 25th
This is a cloudy day -- Belle at nine O. clock  this morning was twelve years old.  we all in health.  children all went down street to buy candy at Schultress?. bought baby a white net cap.  Dr. Elliott called to see us after tea.  Mollie Van Buren called to see children so did Dr Van Buren.  Misses Fetter called to see me
Saturday Sept 26th
All the children gone driving with Aunt Virginia.  Mrs Eaches called with her baby.  Misses Thompsons called also Mrs Davis Mrs Heywood & children.  at three Sister Virginia Mattie & James and my four children -- also Mattie Belle & Tom all went to Mr Wartell,s dancing school. children all danced -- Belle & Eva commenced to take music lessons from Mr Gunter to day.  received a letter from Pa to day -- he in New York.  Also received a letter from Mr Badger.  Tuckers children called to see mine. so did Mary Thompson
Sunday Sept 27
It is a lovely day.  we all well -- went to Christ church  took all the children -- saw Mrs Barrets baby baptised.  after church called to see Mrs Sam Page -- an old acquaintance  she just recovered from illness. her son Edward married
Monday Sept 28th
It is a lovely day -- all well.  we went riding. at twelve Sister Belle came round to see us -- with her five weeks old baby -- first time  Dr Rogers called to see me -- so did Mr & Mrs Trabue. Mrs Charles Tucker called to tell me that she wanted me to give her the names of some children -- she wanted to give my children a party.  I went to see her.

[Written above top margin]   Alice Hogen  x
Teusday Sept 29th
Sewing Julia came to see us.  also Sophia.   both old white servantas of ours.  Mattie Sheridan came to see is.  I saw Rhoda at the door   Mr Wastell gave Ada & Sheridan a dancing lesson to day.  I went to Masonic Temple to see a little girl dance who Mr Mastell is learning for the stage.   took children with me.   her name Alice Hogen.   ten years old.   received a letter from Mr Badger    he in Chicago.  Eliza Nock called & Mrs Claytor.  also Mrs Robt Bell.    after tea David and I went to see Hunts.
Wednesday Sept 30th
It looks like rain is beginning & reception day.  Mrs Hunt & Mr Harrison called - also Mrs Sam Hamilton.  Mrs Henry Morton  Mrs L.L. Shreve.  Miss Brown & Sallie Carter  Mrs Floyd and Mrs Tucker.  Mrs Capt Carter wants to give the children a party, and Mollie Van Buren will give them one Friday night    her invitations came to day engraved with Belle & Eva's name on them.   Mr Hunt called with Sallie.   Eliza Morton & Eva Quigley called to see my children.  So did Dora Coleman.   we went out riding late this evening    there are five parties to be given to my children.
Thursday [Sept 31 crossed out] Oct 1st 1863.
bought new tartelons for my children to day - to be trimmed with fowers [sic]   Weather very warm.  we all well.    Mrs Merriwhether called -  it rained all day very much.  Virginia & I went out in her carriage shopping.   bought Boquets and Fans for Tuckers children.   we dressed the four children - and ourselves and took Mattie Shreve with us and went to Mrs Tuckers.    had a splendid evening.   my children received much attention - decided Belles of the evening.   We returned home late.   Mattie Belle Shreve was the beauty of the evening -  she danced so well -- four years old -  Sheridan & Ada received much attention.
Friday Oct 2nd 1863
It has cleared up and sun shining to day -  we all well -   Siss here with her baby.  Mrs Floyds children called.   so did the Marshalls and Furgesons.     at four we arranged the children,   I and Mrs Tuckers Sons Henry & Lou called to take them to Miss Van Burens party.   they went late on account of their new dresses being not finished     a fire broke out in our neighborhood at nine O. clocck.  but did not do much damage.  I sat up for the children untill two O.clock.   retired at three.
Saturday Oct 3rd
we received invitation from Mrs Tucker this morning for all the little chldren to come to Meenies party at five O.clock.  Sister Belle here with her children.     at five we dressed all the children pretty and sent them to the party - Namely, James, Ada, Sheridan & Mattie Faulds.   later we went and took Belle & Eva with us    had a pleasant evening
Saturday Oct 4th
It looks like rain.   we all in health.   went to Unitarian church to hear Mr Heywood who has been here visiting the battle feild [sic] at Chataooga    after tea went with Brother Thomas Shreve to hear Mr Heywood again

Monday Oct 5th
It has been very cold to day -- looked like snow.  we all well.  Virginia & I went out shopping -- bought children new tarletons for Capt Carters daughters party.  Mrs Brewster making them.  Sallie Hunt called to see me.  so did Mrs Heiskell & Etta and Georgie Dumesnil & Mary called to see children and Ashley Pritte Henry Tucker sent Belle a handsome Boquet.  I am writing invitations to day for Mattie Faulds party given to my children    five parties have been given to my little ones.
Teusday Oct 6th
It rains a great deal to day.  we all well.  Virginia & my Belle out all day delivering party tickets -- for Mattie Faulds party -- I stayed at home -- and wrote tickets.  at nine it poured rain -- my three daughters and Jamie all went to Capt Carters -- to his little girl, Sallie,s party given to Belle & Eva -- I went at eleven to bring the children home.  It still rained -- all had a nice time  Mrs. Rawson & May called.
Wednesday Oct 7th 1863.
It has rained again to day.  we all well but Ma -- she has severed pain in her breast.  Virginia went out to buy Curtains this afternoon.  received two letters from Mr Badger.  I went out with Virginia 
Thursday Oct 8th
It has cleared off, and I think will be fair.  I went to Mrs Tuckers with four -- spent a pleasant hour.  I then went to see Mrs Hunt and Siss.  at two O. clock, David & I went to the Menagerie and took all the children with us.  Siss,s children & Virginia,s too.  Virginia & I went out to do some shopping -- went to Schuttrets    he treated us to ice cream.  Virginia ordered her party supper.
Friday Oct 9th
It is a lovely day -- all of us busy fixing for the party of Mattie,s to night.  baby has a bad cold -- at seven the table was laid, and a beautiful table it was -- it was made in a cross -- and each end had a Pyrimid, and one in the centre.  the table was decorated with flowers. and everything was splendid -- birds and meats were reserved for the grown folks.  at eight the little folks began to gather and in a little while --  there were over sixty children -- and about twenty grown persons.  they were dressed exquisitely -- my children were very happy.  at eleven they had their supper.  a fine band of music and everything passed off beautifully  Sister Belle came and her children -- Miss Lillie Ward called to see me --
Saturday Oct 10th
Sister Belle and family has spent the day with us.  we all feel very tired -- and we have fixed out several waiters of good things to send to some friends -- Sheridan very sick to day with Pneumonia -- I sent for Dr Casparie -- received a letter from Mr Badger

Sunday Oct 11th 1863.
This is a lovely day -- we all well but Sheridan & baby -- none of us went to church .  last friday Julia Sullivan sent a note to me saying she was ill and wished I would come and see her.  I did so and found her very low with consumption -- which she has had many years. I went twice to see her to day -- she could scarce speak -- and at twelve O. clock at night she died.  poor Julia had a hard time -- sick for many years, and yet toiling for her living -- she was once seamstress for me--
Monday Oct 12
Sheridan is better to day -- but baby is very sick with Pneumonia.  I was up a great deal last night with him -- and to day he is no better -- it is a bad day -- raining and damp.  I wrote to Joe, Mr Badger & Pa -- Dr Casparri is coming to see the baby -- Ellen and I was up most of the night with baby again.
Teusday Oct 13th
It is very damp -- but not raining -- baby still the same -- no change  Dr says he has decided Pneumonia -- Virginia & children gone to see Siss.  Fredricka has brought me a very pretty basket -- she made for me -- of cows horn and paper flowers.  Dr Came again to see baby -- Mr Hunt called to see me -- I wrote the invitations for Mattie Shreve,s party to day -- 
Wednesday Oct 14th
This is a damp day -- but does not rain -- my baby shows no signs of recovery yet -- is very much oppressed in breathing -- Sheridan has been sick every day since the party -- he is quite sick -- Sister Belle came and spent the day with her little family -- we stayed at home nursing all day --Mrs Harrison called to day -- I have been all day suffering with a pain in my side from nursing my fat baby --
Thursday Oct 15th 1863.
It is warm to day & sunny -- I think it is our Indian Summer.  baby better to day-- but Sheridan worse -- suffering much pain in his bowels -- Mrs Hunt & Sallie called -- so did Mrs Semple & children --& Mrs Barrets children and Mrs Heywood & Cochran and Fannie Henning-- also the Morris,s -- my children out riding
Friday Oct 16th
It is a beautiful day -- all of us well, but Sheridan -- he still quite sick     I have been up night & day with him & baby for a week.
Saturday Oct 17th
It is a bright day -- Sheridan much better -- Sister Belle came and spent the day with her family -- my three girls out visiting in Sister Belle,s carriage      at one O. clock my husband arrived from Chicago    had a bad sick headache -- he brought me a splendid scarlet velvet bonnet   a white Plush hat for Ada -- Mattie Belle and one for Sallie Carter -- also two brown silk beavers for Mrs Tuckers children -- I made them prensents for them -- and a black Plush for my baby -- and a silk beaver for Sheridan -- and Onyx earings for Belle & Eva and a pair for Mattie Faulds.  Belle & Eva went to Tuckers to supper.
Sunday Oct 18th
It is a beautiful day -- I went to Christ church -- with my three daughters we went to see Siss -- Henry Tucker & Herman Newcomb called to see children. I wrote a little to day -- my children better --
Monday Oct 19th
Virginia & I went shopping -- my children better.  Sister Belle came up to see us     Mr Badger & children took breakfast with Mr Shreve.  Mr Badger and David dined with Mr. Shreve & after dinner we all went out to drive.

Tuesday Oct 20th 1863.  
It looks like rain. Sister Mrs unclear and my children out all day distributing party tickets for Matties? unclear party on Friday given to any children. I unclear the tickets received letters from my father who is at New Orleans. Mister Powels? called to see me. Brother unclear & Sister Mrs. Badger and I all went to Charles unclear to tea, spent a pleasant evening - returned at half past eleven.
Wednesday Oct 21st
It is a lovely bright day - Ada not well, with a cold - all the rest well - I am going to my dress maker and then going visiting with Mrs unclear. Mrs unclear called to see me - so we did not visit. at seven Mrs Badger & myself went to supper at Mrs Pearsons? - spent a pleasant evening. Thursday Oct 22nd It is a lovely day. My children all out walking & riding. I went visiting with my husband called on Mrs W. Newcomb, Mrs Heywood? and Mrs unclear. Took five O'clock with Mrs A. D. Hunt - after dinner went to Brother unclear. Mrs Dulaney & Mrs unclear came to see me also Mr & Mrs Bridgeford all of us there but unclear - he still has a cold.
Friday Oct 23rd It has rained most of the day. I went to Sister Belle?, to assist her arrange for the party tonight - given by her daughter Mattie Belle? to my unclear - returned to Sister Virginia to dinner, and began to arrange for my children - was disappointed in my childrens new dresses - they unclear tarlatan? trimmed with white satin ribbon - at nine? their dresses came and they put them on. White tarlatan? trimmed with scarlet unclear. There was a very large company and every thing passed? off delightfully - Sister had a fine supper - we returned home at unclear. Had sister & little baby - for a day or two - Mrs unclear called.
Saturday October 24th
It is a lovely bright morning - Sister Virginia ordered out her carriage early. Mrs. Badger?, myself, & children all went to say goodbye to Brother Thomas unclear. We had lunch early and at one took the omnibus and left for Chicago much to our regret. [[little Tom?\\ I know is still at Mothers quite sick with cold - Dr. Lapierre attending him, at three I went to unclear Belle, and spent the evening
Sunday Oct 25th Again the weather is lovely. I went to Christ Church and took all the children with me - Tom a little better. Sister Belle came and took him. We all quite well - Herman Newcomb - Henry & unclear Tucker, also Abraham Hoffman called to see Belle and Eva. Monday Oct 26th It looks like rain - and cold - Mary Tyler Johnson called to see me. Also Mrs Boules, Mrs. May & Lilly?

?
Wastell Nov 2nd
Friday Oct 30th 1863.
It pours rain to day -- I went out in Virginia Carriage a little while -- then I took Sister Belle,s Carriage and went and paid some bills -- Sister Virginia & family took dinner with us.  baby still had some croup.  all the rest well.
Saturday Oct 31st
It is a very bright day -- all well I went in Sister Belle, s Carriage to see Mrs Hunt & Ma -- at three I took all four of my children and Sister Belle -- Sister Virginia & and their children to Mr Wastell,s dancing school -- there were many people there. my little ones deemed to be the favourites -- Mrs Steward just finished the childrens blue Merino dresses and ?,s they beautiful.
Sunday Nov 1st 1863.
It is again a fine day -- we all well -- I went to Christ Church with my little children.  called to see Ma -- Sister Virginia & family took dinner with us. my children had some young beau,s to call on them --
Monday Nov 2nd
It looks like rain to day -- I went in Sister Belle,s Carriage visiting -- called on Mrs Capt Carter.  Mrs Hopkins -- Mrs ? Carter.  Mrs James Wilder Mrs Semple Mrs Quigley -- Children made some calls.  returned home at three -- Mr Wastell gave Ada & Sheridan to day dancing lessons.  he is learning Ada the rope dance -- Mrs Tuckers children & Mollie Van Buren took tea with us to night.  after tea Jonny? Campbell & Charley Martin came in -- had a pleasant night.
Teusday Nov 3rd
It rains to day -- I went to see Mrs Page and do some shopping -- took early dinner with Ma -- Mr Wastell gave children their lessons --  Dora Coleman called to see us.  So did Herman Newcomb -- after tea Brother David Virginia Mattie & James all came round -- and took us to the Catholic Fair -- Bell Eva & myself -- we stayed a little while -- then all went to the Theatre -- all of us very well -- Mrs Hutchings & children called to see me --
Wednesday Nov 4th
It is bright out -- looks like rain -- Mrs Bowles -- Lilly & Miss Shreve called to se  us. Mrs James Trabue? called and invited us all to a party at her house on Friday night -- Mr Wastell gave children their lesson -- Mrs Ed Wilder called -- so did Mrs Heywood -- after tea Mrs Jarvis & her children called to see us.  we all well but Shreve -- he still has croup.
Thursday Nov 5th
It again looks like rain -- we all well -- Emma Tyler & Mary Breed came to see me to day -- Sister Belle & I went out riding.  Mr Wastell gave children their lesson. Re?ceived Mr Gunter.  Sister Belle invited Fannie Burten & Husband to tea -- also Mr & Mrs Tucker.  we had a pleasant evening -- Charley Martin & Jonny? Campbell called to see Belle & Eva -- Mamie Thompson called and invited the children to a party at her house to morrow night -- given to them.
Friday Nov 6th
It is a lovely warm day -- after breakfast Sister Belle ordered her Carriage -- and she Belle, Eva & Mattie Belle all went with me to Mr Craiks our Minister -- Mrs Bowles -- Mrs Tom Sheve,s and Mrs Hutchings -- at 8 o clock -- Belle & Eva went to Mamie Thompsons party -- and Mr & Mrs Faulds went with me, to a large party at Mrs Trabue,s?.  Mr Hunt came to see me -- Eva learning to dance the rope dance--
Saturday Nov 7th
It is still beautiful weather -- all well -- children out playing  Sister Belle Eva, Belle, & Mattie Shreve -- all went out to Mrs Dumesnil? and made a call. returned to dinner -- and went to dancing school -- Mr Heywood came to see me -- after tea Dr Elliott called to see us all -- it is blowing ?
Sunday Nov 8th
It is cool to day but sunny -- we all well -- I went with Brother Shreve to Unitarian church we heard Mr Heywood preach -- saw many friends -- after dinner Herman Newcomb -- R Hopkins & Henry & Lou Tucker & Bullock -- called to see Belle & Eva -- my baby not very well to night. David dined? with us.  Belle & Eva put on their first corsets to day --

Nov 12 returned home
Monday Nov 9 1863.
It is very cold to day -- all of us well.  at 12 Oclock Mrs Looney called to see me.  received a letter from Mr Badger.  He disappointed at our not returning home.  I called to see Mr Hunt.  Sister Virginia came for us all to come to her house -- and stay untill we returned home -- we went at two O. clock -- after dinner I went down town to do some shopping.
Teusday Nov 10th
It is again a pleasant day -- but cool -- yet not as cold as yesterday --I went visiting with my three children to day -- called on Mrs James Wilder  Mrs Ed Wilder --Mrs Powell -- Mrs Andrew Low Mrs Feilder Mrs Tyler -- Mrs Marshall -- Mrs Eaches -- Mrs Trabue & Mrs Edmonds & Mrs Shotwell -- all of us well -- Sister Belle spent day with us.
Wednesday Nov 11th
It is a lovely day -- not so cool as yesterday.  I went and said "Good Bye" to Mrs Page. Mrs Nock. Mrs Rawson.  Mrs Tucker, Dr Rogers & Mrs Hunt -- I met Mrs General Grant at Mrs Sam Pages -- he is her Nephew -- she is there to stay all winter.  Sister Belle & family stayed all day with us.  I sent my children to see Mrs Tyle & Mrs Page.  Eva been all day sick with indigestion -- all the children busy tonight pulling candy --
Thursday Nov 12th
It is again warm & Sunny -- all well but Eva.  she much better.  after breakfast my children went to say Good Bye - to some little friends -- I called to see Mrs Rawson Mrs Hunt Mrs Page Dr Rogers -- at one the Omnibus drove up to our door and my party got in -- consisting of myself five children & two Nurses.  I took one from Louisville this time named Anna Steward the other Nurse Ellen Donenen has been with me seven years.  Miss Garnet was under my protection -- she going to Chicago.  Brother Faulds intended to come up with us but he was sick.  Sister Belle Shreve gave Belle an Onyx breastpin and white scarfs.  We reached Inianapolis safe -- but I lost my purse with twenty five dollars in it.  we slept well in the Car and arrived at half past seven in Chicago
Friday Nov 13th
When we arrived Mr Badger was there in Depot to meet us -- and Mrs Garnet to get her daughter -- we had two Carriages to take our party up to our house found everything nice and ready for us.  our coloured Nancy delighted to see us and Henry too -- we found a fine breakfast -- oysters birds and sweet Bread -- also Steak -- beside all the side dishes -- our house warm with steam, and everything looking well -- I unpacked.  and after dinner went to the stores to buy some goods to send to Louisville -- to fill an order.  called to see Sister Hilton -- found her sick with cold.  Walter Hilton & Willie Heiskell here to night playing Billiards -- Belle sick  sore throat -- Ada too.  I was grieved to hear of the death of the childrens school Teacher, Mrs. Grover who died Suddenly of congestion of the lungs.  it is a great loss.  Mr Badger opened a large cask of glass ware to night bought in New York.  they are handsome -- a beautiful toilet Set also -- Brother Sheridan sent children some pretty China Ornaments.
Saturday Nov 14th
It is a rainy ugly day -- baby not well -- indeed all the children are complaining -- I have been busy all day -- setting house to rights -- Lilly Scamm?on called on my children -- Mr Badger & Octave playing Billiards -- Eva has cold --
Sunday Nov 15th
This is an ugly day -- raining & cloudy -- Father Badger John Hilton & Horace came to see me -- after dinner Mr Badger & I went out to Father Badgers  found all well -- it still rains

Nov 21st School
Loomis & Taylor
Teusday Nov 17th. Joseph Gillett 70
This morning not cloudy -- but after dinner -- the sun rose and it was pleasant.  I wrote a note to Sallie Ward Hunt and then went down town -- bought children scarfs and Cakes -- all still with cold -- received letters from home -- they all sick with cold -- Ada gone to Licinia,s to stay a little while.
Wednesday Nov 18th
it is a lovely bright sunny day -- Belle & Eva gone to their Aunt Hiltons to dinner  I ordered a Carriage and Ada and went visiting -- called on four brides.  Mrs Gutherie Mrs Bigelow Mrs Huntington & Mrs Hudson.  also Mrs Judge Morris Mrs Brown & Mrs Thomas.  bought a new pair of gloves -- returned at five.  Ada had a little party -- she invited her Cousins -- Alice & Florence -- after tea we spent evening with Mrs Hilton -- I bought the three children new poplin scarfs.
Thursday Nov 19th
It is a dark ugly day  -- my baby sick again with Croup -- all the rest well. I wrote to day to Virginia & Siss -- Mr Fisher called -- Willie Heiskell here playing Billiards -- Hannah my sewing girl came to see us.
Friday Nov 20th
This a bright day -- all of us well -- I sent for a hack, and took my three girls and went visiting -- called on Mrs Flint -- Miss Adele just returned and Mr Feild came with her -- I then called on Miss Garnet -- Mrs Clark. Mrs Sherman -- Mrs King Mrs James Miller Mrs Arthur Mrs Farlin Mrs Hadduck. Mrs Wheeler & Bishop Duggan.  Ella Badger came to see me -- Belle & Eva took tea with their Aunt Hilton -- received letters from home __
Saturday Nov 21st
It is cold to day -- after dinner I went down town with Belle & Eva -- they bought Candy - and took tea again with Licinia -- Mr Feild called to see me -- baby still has bad cold -- I went to see Mr Grover and entered the children for Monday --Mr Grover feels sadly.  Belle Shed tears at seeing the school room where the teacher she loved so well used to sit --
Sunday Nov 22nd
It is a lovely day -- we all went to Mr Thomas,s new Unitarian church Corner of Wabash and Hubbard Court -- church was in the vestry room -- Belle & Eva went with Father Badger to the west end  after dinner I went out with Ada & Sheridan  Willie Heiskell came home with us.
Monday Nov 23rd
It is a cold dreary day -- I went to school with children and gave them to their new teachers Miss Patterson & Miss Glenn -- under Mr Grover,s superintendence -- after dinner Eva had a little party -- Belle gone down town to buy new books --
Teusday Nov 24th
It is an ugly rainy and windy -- children gone to school.  at Six O.clock much to the surprise of all, Aunt Harriett Wendell from Rock Island came to make a visit with her sons James & Stanwood -- I had a room got ready for her -- after tea Mr Feild & Miss Flint called to see us --
Wednesday Nov 25th
This has been a cold day but bright -- I made Belle,s Theatrical clothes to day -- she takes part in Pantomime play at Father Badgers on Thanksgiving day -- I went down street  had my Sisters hats packed to day for Louisville -- they were red velvet like mine -- Mrs Jagos? called to see me  Belle gone to the farm with Octavius -- baby better of his cold -- after tea Aunt Harriet Mr Badger -- Eva & myself all play Billiards -- fine playing it was.  This ends my large volume --
